title: deku's_photo_of_hagakure_toru
body:
Redraws of a drawing by [[Horikoshi Kouhei]] featuring a photo of [[Hagakure Toru]] taken by [[Midoriya Izuku]].

This drawing is part of the [b]Horikoshi Kohei's "My Hero Academia" Original Art Exhibition[/b] (堀越耕平『僕のヒーローアカデミア』原画展), which ran from the 21st of June 2025 to the 31st of August 2025 at Creative Museum Tokyo.

Part of this exhibition is a collection of illustrations featuring photographs taken by [[Midoriya Izuku]] of various characters presumably timestamped after the final season.
Photos taken of the artworks started appearing online, and a collage posted on Twitter caused these to go viral.
The illustration of Toru in particular caused people to speculate about the relation between Toru and Izuku and inspired artists to make their own versions of it.

h4. Images
* !post #9585672: Cropped
* !asset #27438155: Larger Photo
* !asset #27438150: Twitter Collage

h4. External Links
* https://heroaca-ex.com/
* "Creative Museum Tokyo: 堀越耕平『僕のヒーローアカデミア』原画展":[https://creative-museum.tokyo/exhibitions/heroaca/?lang=en]
* "DCInside.com: [일반] 원화전 짤들을 더 찾았음 ㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋ":[https://gall.dcinside.com/mgallery/board/view/?id=hiroaka&no=486388]
* "Reddit: Horikoshi Exhibition Art 'Snapshots taken by Deku' leaks Megathread":[https://www.reddit.com/r/BokuNoHeroAcademia/comments/1lmvfsq/horikoshi_exhibition_art_snapshots_taken_by_deku/]
* "Twitter Collage":[https://x.com/Itznotlilz/status/1937853479399145524]

title: our_life:_now_and_forever
body:
Spiritual successor to [[Our Life: Beginnings and Always]]. This game is currently in development.
A [[visual novel]] by GB Patch Games that combines slice-of-life, coming-of-age, and a growing-up simulator into one. The main gameplay is separated into four Steps to signify each stage of life and highly focuses on being entirely customizable from the player's every bit of appearance, mannerisms, nicknames, and personality of either Qiu Lin or Tamarack Buchanan. While this game features two base love interests, the character can only pursue one romantically.

h4. Characters
* [[Main Character (our_life)|]], the customizable main character and playable protagonist, whose default name is Franky Second.
* [[Qiu Lin (our life)|]] and [[Tamarack Baumann]], the two female love interests.
* [[Opal Second]], the main character's mother.
* [[Hong Lin]] and [[Yi Lin (our life)|]], the father and mother of Qiu Lin.
* [[Dorothea Baumann]] and [[Ernst Baumann]], the grandmother and grandfather of Tamarack. 
* [[Baxter Ward]], a returning character from previous series. He was a DLC love interest in Our Life 1.
* [[Renee Murray]], a friend of Qiu Lin and Baxter Ward.
* [[Devin Murray]], Renee Murray's brother. 
* [[Shannon Murray]], the mother of Renee and Devin Murray, while also being the 5th grade teacher of the main character, Qiu Lin, and Tamarack Baumann. 
* [[Pran Taylor]], a cameo character from previous series.
* [[Vianca]], a friend option for Qiu Lin, Tamarack Baumann, and the main character. 
* [[Serenity]], a close friend of Qiu Lin.
* [[Kiyan Yusuf]], the owner a local diner, the Diner Table.

h4. See also:
* [[Our Life: Beginnings And Always]]

title: black_doom
body:
The main antagonist in [[Shadow the Hedgehog]]'s self-titled [[shadow_the_hedgehog_(game)|game]]. His face has three yellow eyes and two large [[horns]], and wears multiple comet-based pendants.
He is the leader of the Black Arms, an [[alien]] race that inhabits the Black Comet, which is said to pass near the Earth once every 50 years.
Black Doom aided [[Gerald Robotnik]] in the creation of Shadow by providing his DNA in exchange of receiving the seven [[chaos_emerald|Chaos Emeralds]] as an asset for his future invasion.

Shadow can align with Black Doom's army by carrying out Dark missions and having one of his [[doom's_eye_(sonic)|eyes]] follow him, or support [[sonic_the_hedgehog|Sonic]] and his friends on their efforts against his invasion by completing Hero missions. Regardless, he acts as the game's final boss by assuming the two-headed form of [[Devil Doom]], and dueling [[Super Shadow]].
H4. See also
* [[sonic_x_shadow_generations|Shadow Generations]]
* "Sonic Wiki":https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Black_Doom

title: neapolitan_palette
body:
Color scheme based around pink, brown, and white/cream, like [[neapolitan ice cream]]. It is popular in cute/girly Japanese design and fashion, often paired with themes of [[chocolate]] and [[sweets]] and elements like [[lace]] and [[bow]]s.

h4. Examples

* !post #8830159
* !post #5587849

h4. See also

* [[choco girl]]
* [[color coordination]]
* [[pink theme]]
* [[mint chocolate]]

title: choco_girl
body:
A visual aesthetic popular in kawaii subculture and j-fashion in the 2000s and early 2010s, themed around [[chocolate]] and other sweets. It most commonly follows a [[neapolitan palette]] (brown-cream-pink), but a [[mint chocolate]] inspired palette is also occasionally used. Like with most other design languages of the time, this name is a retronym, a name given to something after the fact.

In addition to imagery of sweets, common elements include [[polka dot]]s, stripes, [[lace]], [[musical note]]s and [[treble clef]]s, [[piano keys]], [[ribbon]]s and [[heart]]s. [[Himekaji]] and/or [[sweet lolita]] fashion is often worn, as well as other girly kei-adjacent styles.

h4. Examples

* !post #7911135
* !post #1861739

h4. See also

* [[Heisei Retro]]
* [[Tag Group:Visual aesthetic]]

h4. External links

* "Aesthetics Wiki: Choco Girl":https://aesthetics.fandom.com/wiki/Choco_Girl

title: fox
body:
A small omnivorous wild canine genus (Vulpes) that consists of numerous species around the world, as well as colloquially including a few similar non-Vulpes canids. Foxes are best known for their bushy tails and pointed snouts, as well as their curious and playful behavior.

Foxes are very important to Japanese folklore, being the center of the [[kitsune]] myths, often being depicted with multiple tails - up to a total of [[kyuubi|nine]].

[[baby animal|Young]] foxes are called kits.

h4. Varieties

* !post #9501234: Red fox
* !post #1030313: [[Ezo red fox]]

title: shirobakama_chii
body:
[b]The Little Fencer who's a Match for a Thousand[/b]

The Stage 2 boss of the [[Touhou]] fangame [[Hollow Song of Birds]]. Later reappears in Stage 6 alongside [[Torisumi Horou]], and the Extra Stage alongside [[Fujitsubo Mumei]].

Chii is the [[Tsukumogami]] of a small [[toothpick]], and as such, is described as having an inchling-like stature. Because of this, she is almost always seen carrying a toothpick around, usually like a [[sword]].

She has [[short hair|short]] light [[blue hair]] which is tied into a [[ponytail]] using a [[blue bow]] that has her name imprinted on it in kanji (ちい). Additionally, she has [[blue eyes]].

She wears a white [[haori]] (or [[white kimono]]) which is tied together by a [[sash]], as well as a matching [[hakama]]. Confusingly, she doesn't seem to be wearing any sort of [[undershirt]] or [[chest sarashi]].

Chii has the ability to multiply herself by imparting other toothpicks with their own will; multiple instances of the character should be tagged with [[clone]].

title: jack_baker
body:
The secondary antagonist of [[Resident Evil 7: Biohazard]].

A deranged serial killer whose family was responsible for the mass kidnappings around Dulvey.

[spoiler]It was later revealed that Jack and his family became infected by the mold superorganism after they encountered [[Eveline |Eveline]], a human bioweapon created by The Connections capable of mind control. During the part of the shipwreck, Ethan encountered Jack in a vision, revealing to himself to be remorseful for his actions and pleads Ethan to free his family from Eveline's influence.[/spoiler]

title: jeanne_d'arc_(swimsuit_archer)_(third_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[Jeanne d'Arc (Swimsuit Archer) (fate)|]] in her Third Ascension swimsuit from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She keeps her hair down except for a pair of side ponytails tied with green bows, and also has a green hairband plus her Ruler-class headpiece. She wears a white dress swimsuit with a diamond-shaped navel cutout, which is layered beneath another see-through dress, a see-through capelet covered in green ribbons, a fur collar with a green bowtie, white gloves, a thighlet on her left leg, and white sandals. She uses a magical halo for her attacks.

h4. Appearance
* !post #9178786

title: sitonai_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]] character first appearing in the [[Gotterdammerung (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt. An Alter Ego-class pseudo-Servant who is three divine spirits in one body - the Ainu Kamuy Sitonai, the Norse goddess Freyja and the Finnish witch-queen Louhi inhabiting the body of [[Illyasviel von Einzbern]], specifically the one from [[Fate/Stay Night]].

Appearance-wise, she is simply [[Illyasviel von Einzbern]] wearing an approximation of [[ainu clothes]] in white with purple trims and accents, using patterns based on triangles and rhombuses instead of traditional Ainu patterning. She is carrying a short [[sword]]. This apparently is due to Sitonai having the strongest influence out of the divine trio in her body. Her hair is also in [[low-tied sidelocks]], while Illya leaves her sidelocks untied.

She also carries a [[bow (weapon)|]] for her Noble Phantasm, and is seen in battle with a large white bear named [[Shirou (bear) (fate)|Shirou]] at her side.

For tagging purposes, she considered a different character than [[Illyasviel von Einzbern]]. Only tag both if both are in the image.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[BLACK (artist)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kadowaki Mai]]

title: river_(pokemon)
body:
[b]River[/b], known as [b]Rui[/b] in Japan, is the female player character in [[new pokemon snap|New Pokémon Snap]].

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[brown hair]] worn in a [[ponytail]]. She wears an [[orange hat|orange]] [[visor cap]], a [[wristband]], [[denim shorts]], [[striped pantyhose]], [[white shoes]], and carries a [[backpack]] and [[camera]].

body:

A member of Protocol along with [[Exia (nikke)|]], Novel is a big fan of [[Arthur Conan Doyle]]'s [[Sherlock Holmes]] series of fiction, thus being a detective herself.

She has [[green eyes]] with [[+ +]] pupils and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], [[sidelocks]] & [[short twintails]]. She wears an [[orange hat|orange]] [[deerstalker]], a [[brown cloak|brown]] [[plaid cloak]], [[white shirt]], [[black skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[brown boots|brown]] [[high heel boots]].

title: bao_(kof)
body:
[[The King of Fighters]] character.

He is an adolescent Chinese boy with [[brown hair]], an [[orange hat|orange]] peaked [[beret]] that goes with his [[Chinese clothes]]. He wears [[white shoes]] and [[black socks]] both of which go with the lines on his clothes.

He borrowed some Psycho Power from brother figure [[Sie Kensou]] at the cost of Kensou having to fight without Psycho Powers.

He is the adoptive grandson of [[Chin Gentsai]], the latter of whom doubles as his mentor.

title: stone_kirby
body:
A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[Kirby (series)|]] series that lets [[Kirby]] turn into a hard block of [[stone]].

This form's design has varied over the years, but in its modern form, Kirby wears rocks on his head and a [[multicolored headband]] that comes in [[purple headband|purple]], [[pink headband|pink]], and [[orange headband|orange]], alongside a pair of [[white horns]]. In its older forms, Kirby's skin would turn brown or [[grey skin|grey]] and he would wear a [[blue helmet]] with a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hat ribbon|ribbon]] at the end like a tail.

h4. Icon

!asset #24731348

title: neisa_(pandea_work)
body:
An original character by [[pandea work]]. Has [[large breasts]], [[blue eyes]], and [[short hair|short]], dark hair, which varies from [[black_hair|black]], [[blue_hair|blue]], or [[purple_hair|purple]], depending on the illustration.

Best known for a "mod":[https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/75333] for [[The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim]] by the artist wherein she's a swordswoman for hire with custom dialogue, and offers unique services such as skill training, buffs, and giving the player her [[breast milk in container|breast milk]].

title: hoyofair
body:
A recurring Web Event that presents a collation of fan works derived from [[Mihoyo|HoYoverse]] IPs.

HoYoFair content is fanmade but officially sponsored and approved by HoYoverse. The event showcases fan-created animations, art, and short films inspired by HoYoverse games. These creations are secondary works and do not represent the official storyline or character designs from the games themselves.

title: brave_new_world_(book)
body:
A dystopian novel by English author Aldous Huxley. The novel is set in a fictional future where humanity is governed by a world government, whose citizens are environmentally and genetically engineered into an intelligence-based social hierarchy. Individual thought, proper emotions, and creativity are shunned and gross hedonism in the form of drugs, casual sex, and other forms of entertainment is encouraged to promote a society that's entirely based on instant gratification.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Brave New World":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brave_New_World

title: people
body:
Unnamed background characters that are not part of an image's focus, usually to bring life to a scene and make spaces look less empty. They may be drawn at considerable distance from the viewer (post #1648083), or the artist may use other means to establish that they are not a significant part of the image (post #2370885). In general, characters described by this tag don't count towards tags like [[multiple girls]] and [[multiple boys]].

If there are large number of background people in the image, the tag [[crowd]] is applicable.

h4. See also

* [[audience]]
* [[crowd]]
* [[faceless]]
* [[solo focus]]

title: yueya_chan
body:
Hanji: 月牙鏟 (Traditional Chinese / Japanese) / 月牙铲 (Simplified Chinese) 
Pronunciation: [i]yuèyá chǎn[/i] (Chinese) / [i]getsuga-san[/i] (Japanese) 

A Chinese [[polearm]] whose name literally means "Crescent Moon Spade". Also known as a Shaolin spade or monk's spade, it is most famously the weapon of [[Sha Wujing]] from the classic novel [[Journey to the West]] 

h4.External Link 

* Wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monk%27s_spade

title: vajra_(object)
body:
Originally from Hindu mythology, the vajra is the [[weapon]] of the thunder god Indra (analagous to Thor's hammer Mjolnir in Norse mythology). It is a small, two-headed [[club (weapon)|]] with multiple prongs on each head, and symbolizes both the properties of a diamond (indestructibility) and a thunderbolt (irresistible force). From Hinduism the concept spread, manifesting as a weapon-shaped ritual item used in Tantric and Tibetan branches of Buddhism.

The terms appearing below are subtypes of vajra. 

* 独鈷杵 (Japanese: [i]tokkosho / dokkosho[/i]): It has a handle with both ends like the ears of a spear. This term appeared in [[Toramaru Shou]]'s "spell card":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Undefined_Fantastic_Object/Spell_Cards/Stage_5#Spell_Card_71 (Her weapon is not a vajra, though.) 
* 三鈷杵 ([i]sankosho[/i]) : It has a handle with both ends like trident. 
* 五鈷杵 ([i]gokosho[/i]): used by [[Sowaka-chan]]. 

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia: Vajra":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vajra

title: chinpo_ni_wa_katenakatta_yo
body:
[quote]
「絶対チ○ポなんかに 負けたりしない!! (キッ) 」 ("I'll never lose... To a d*ck!!" [with a resolute face])
「チ○ポには勝てなかったよ・・・」 ("I couldn't win... Against the p*nis...")
[/quote]

A pair of phrases based on Circle [[kiryuu_kazumasa_(bitch_bokujou)|Bitch Bokujou]]'s 2007 [[Lyrical Nanoha]] doujin, "Chotto Bitch na Fate Mama".  One of the two is sometimes omitted.

In the story [[Fate Testarossa]] vowed to [[takamachi_nanoha|Nanoha]] in her mind that she would never surrender to the [[penis|dick]] of an old fat mama's boy. Just three pages later, she accepted her surrender to his penis. When the images were posted to [[Futaba Channel]], they "omitted the two pages in between":/posts/2596063 and made the scene more funny.

It is a subset of the "almost comically instant loss" ("即堕ち":[http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E5%8D%B3%E5%A0%95%E3%81%A1]) [[meme]]/fetish, along with the infamous [[instant loss]] and [[rape]] fetish works.

h4. See also

* [[ahegao]]
* [[instant loss]]

h4. External links

* "Doujinshi.org: Original doujin":http://www.doujinshi.org/book/109401/ and "its remake version":http://www.doujinshi.org/book/522802/
* "DLsite.com (JP): Original doujin (648 JPY)":http://www.dlsite.com/maniax/work/=/product_id/RJ034827.html
* "Nicopedia":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/4498024
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%81%A1%E3%82%93%E3%81%BD%E3%81%AB%E3%81%AF%E5%8B%9D%E3%81%A6%E3%81%AA%E3%81%8B%E3%81%A3%E3%81%9F%E3%82%88%E2%80%A6

title: imminent_uno_loss_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] based on an image of a woman playing an [[Uno (game)|]] card game, smiling confidently as she has only one card left in her hand. However, her opponent's hand is full of Draw 4 (and sometimes Draw 2) cards that can easily defeat her.

Sometimes, the hand is substituted with [b]all five pieces of [[Exodia the Forbidden One]][/b], which results in an instant win when revealed in [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]]

Spiked in popularity with the release of [[mimukauwa_nice_try_(vocaloid)|Mimukauwa Nice Try]], a song that features Miku undergoing this exact fate.

h4. See Also
* [[instant loss]]

Wears a [[fur hat]] with [[horns]] on it.

title: ai_scream!_(love_live!)
body:
A song from [[Love Live!]] performed by [[AiScReam (love live!)|]]. It went viral shortly after its performance at the [[Love Live! Series Asia Tour 2024]].

Besides the [[official alternate costume|costume]], there is also an often-[[parody|parodied]] section of the [[lyrics]] that goes as follows:

[quote]

ルビィちゃん！ 何が好き？ [tn]([[Kurosawa Ruby|Ruby-chan]]! (YES!) What do you like?)[/tn]
チョコミント よりも あ･な･た♡ [tn](Choco Mint, but I like･you･more♡)[/tn]
歩夢ちゃん！ 何が好き？ [tn]([[Uehara Ayumu|Ayumu-chan]]! (Yes) What do you like?)[/tn]
ストロベリーフレイバー よりも あ･な･た♡ [tn](Strawberry Flavor, but I like･you･more♡)[/tn]
四季ちゃん！ 何が好き？ [tn]([[Wakana Shiki|Shiki-chan]]! (yes) What do you like?)[/tn]
クッキー＆クリーム よりも あ･な･た♡ [tn](Cookie and Cream, but I like･you･more♡)[/tn]
みんな 何が好き？ [tn](Everyone (YES!) What do you like?)[/tn]
モチロン大好き AiScReam [tn](Of course, our favorite AiScReam)[/tn]
[/quote]

h4. Costume
* !post #8774337

h4. External links
* "YouTube: Official Lyric Video":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L1mFVp9IM9c]

title: eostre_(mythology)
body:
Ēostre ([ˈeːostre])[1][2][3] is an Anglo-Saxon goddess mentioned by Bede in his 8th century work The Reckoning of Time. He wrote that pagan Anglo-Saxons had held feasts in her honour during the month named after her: Ēosturmōnaþ (April), and that this became the English name for the Paschal season: Easter.

The Old High German name for April was the cognate Ôstarmânoth, which has led scholars to suggest there was a similar Continental Germanic goddess, *Ôstara. Their theory is supported by votive inscriptions dedicated to goddesses called the matronae Austriahenae, found in 1958 in Rhein-Erft-Kreis, Germany. The theonym may also be a part of some placenames and personal names.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C4%92ostre

title: yande-kun
body:
An [[original]] character created by [[Pepoyo]].  

The older brother of [[Shinde-Chan]]. He has no legs and uses Taiji, a weighing scale, to move around.

title: shinde-chan
body:
An [[original]] character created by [[Pepoyo]].  

The younger sister of [[Yande-Kun]] who died of illness. The ones with blood wings on their backs are her clones created by Yande-kun.

title: parzival_(mythology)
body:
Perceval (/ˈpɜːrsɪvəl/, also written Percival, Parzival, Parsifal), alternatively called Peredur (Welsh pronunciation: [pɛˈrɛdɨr]), is a figure in the legend of King Arthur, often appearing as one of the Knights of the Round Table. First mentioned by the French author Chrétien de Troyes in the tale Perceval, the Story of the Grail, he is best known for being the original hero in the quest for the Grail before being replaced in later literature by Galahad.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perceval

body:
A character from the [[Utawarerumono]] series. She is the daughter of [[Hakuowlo]] and [[Mikoto (Utawarerumono)|]]. First appeared in the original game's CG (post #73365) as a baby only, without a name or an explanation of her fate, but generally believed to be the direct ancestor of [[Eruruu]] family.

She officially appeared as an obtainable character in the mobile game [[Utawarerumono: Lost Flag]]. Voiced by [[Iwami Manaka]].

title: trick_snack_(honkai:_star_rail)
body: A consumable item that restores Technique Points, resembling the wasabi peas often found in rice cracker mixes. Popularly associated with [[Acheron (Honkai: Star Rail)|]], due to her instant-kill Technique allowing players to quickly clear stages without going into battle mode. Later this role was taken up by [[Phainon (honkai: star rail)|]] as well.

title: film_reel
body:
A circular metal container composed of a central spool with which a [[film strip|strip of film]] is wrapped and side rims that help to retain the film. It can be inserted or affixed to a [[projector]] to play back video.  When not in use, a film reel may be stored in a metal [[film canister]].

Not to be confused with the similarly appearing [[magnetic tape]], a form of electronic data storage that may also be used on a reel.

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Reel—Motion picture terminology": [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reel#Motion_picture_terminology]

body:
Independent male [[idol]]/[[utaite]] group originating on Niconico and YouTube, consisting of [[Nanamori (stpri)|]], [[Root (stpri)|]], [[Colon (stpri)|]], [[Satomi (stpri)|]], [[Rinu (stpri)|]], and [[Jel (stpri)|]]. They’re currently working under STPR Inc.

They are known for not revealing their real faces except to show them directly at live performances. Instead, they use their own unique anime character designs on the web. Sometimes they even perform with virtual 3D bodies, making them virtual YouTubers in a sense.

title: kiss_(stand)
body:
[[stand (jojo)|Stand]] power of [[Ermes Costello]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 6. Manifests as a humanoid covered in [[sticker]]s, with a head covered in prongs that resemble a crown. The [[sticker]]s have a lip design on them, in reference to the Stand's name.

Kiss's "[[sticker]]s", when placed on an object, cause it to duplicate. Once the [[sticker]] is removed, the objects forcibly fuse back together, which is typically a damaging reaction. Besides this ability, Kiss possesses great strength and speed.

Namesake is the American rock band, Kiss.

title: ermes_costello
body: A supporting character from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 6. Her [[stand (jojo)|Stand]] is [[Kiss (stand)|Kiss]]. Wears her hair in [[dreadlocks]] and has [[scar]]s on her forehead and chin.
other_names: エルメェス・コステロ

title: bruno_bucciarati
body: A central protagonist in [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 5: [[Vento Aureo]]. His [[stand (jojo)|Stand]] is [[sticky fingers (stand)|Sticky Fingers]]. Wears his hair in a [[bob cut]] with two [[hairclip]]s. Reflecting his Stand's power, Buccellati wears a suit with a zipper motif.
other_names: ブローノ・ブチャラティ

title: guido_mista
body:
A supporting character from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 5: [[Vento Aureo]]. His [[Stand (jojo)|]] is [[Sex Pistols (stand)|]]. He has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], often concealed by his distinctive [[hat]] with a downward-facing arrow design in the front, an [[argyle sweater]] that exposes his [[midriff]] as well as [[tiger print]] pants.

[[tetraphobia|Believes the number 4 is unlucky,]] and will go to great lengths to avoid any instance of it in his daily life. This is reflected in the numbering scheme of his Stand.

title: narancia_ghirga
body: A supporting character from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 5. His [[Stand (jojo)|]] is [[Aerosmith (stand)|]].

title: giorno_giovanna
body:
Main protagonist of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 5: [[Vento Aureo]]. Illegitimate son of [[Dio Brando]] ([spoiler]with [[Jonathan Joestar]]'s body[/spoiler]) and an unnamed Japanese woman. Born [[Haruno Shiobana|Shiobana Haruno]] (汐華初流乃), early in his life his mother moved to Italy and married an Italian man, resulting in his name change. 

Has a distinctive hairstyle, blonde with three prominent hair curls in the front and a braided ponytail in back. Some fans jokingly liken his hair to chocolate cornets.

His [[stand (jojo)|Stand]] is [[Gold Experience]].
other_names: ジョルノ・ジョバアーナ
ジョルノ・ジョバァーナ

title: kars_(jojo)
body:
Main antagonist of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 2. Leader of the Pillar Men, ancient vampires vastly superior to those created by the [[stone mask (jojo)|Stone Mask]], which he invented. He has three [[horns]] and [[long hair|long]], [[wavy hair]] and his default attire has him [[topless male]], showing off his [[muscular|muscles]] and [[abs]].

Namesake is the American new wave band The Cars.

title: the_cure_(band)
body: The Cure are an English rock band formed in Crawley in 1976 by Robert Smith (vocals, guitar) and Lol Tolhurst (drums). The band's current line-up comprises Smith, Perry Bamonte (guitar and keyboards), Reeves Gabrels (guitar), Simon Gallup (bass), Roger O'Donnell (keyboards), and Jason Cooper (drums). Smith has remained the only constant member throughout numerous line-up changes since the band's formation, though Gallup has been present for all but two of the band's studio albums.

title: kousaka_airi_(bebebe)
body:
[[original|Original Character]] by [[bebebe (pepegakii)]].

She is an [[oppai loli]] with [[shortstack]] proportions, she has [[aqua eyes]], [[huge breasts]], [[narrow waist]], [[wide hips]], [[thick thighs]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] stylized with a [[two side up]]. She is usually depicted wearing [[taut clothes]] consisting of a [[yellow shirt]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[denim skirt|denim]] [[suspender skirt|suspender]] [[pencil skirt]], [[black thighhighs|black]] [[over-kneehighs]], and [[red shoes]].

Has a [[doyagao]] [[mesugaki]] attitude.

title: arlecchino_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable Pyro character in [[Genshin Impact]]. Also known by the codename "The Knave", she is the fourth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers. She runs an orphanage known as the House of the Hearth.

Her real name is [[Peruere (genshin impact)|]]. Her signature weapon is [[Crimson Moon's Semblance (Genshin Impact)|]].

Like the other Fatui Harbingers, she is named after a stock character in the Italian theater genre "Commedia dell'arte":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commedia_dell%27arte].

h4. Appearance

title: log
body:
A large trunk of a fallen dead [[tree]].

Some people use them to sit on. Smaller logs - which are thick [[branch|branches]] - are burned in a [[fireplace]] for warmth. Stripped and shaped logs are also used to build structures, such as homes.

h4. See also

* [[tree stump]]

title: ginkgo_leaf
body:
Fan-shaped leaf of the [[ginkgo tree]]. Sometimes split in the middle. They start out green and turn yellow in autumn.

h4. Examples
* !post #6238940: Bottom left
* !post #6829794

h4. See also

title: plant
body:
Living organisms belonging to the kingdom Plantae. 
Though they are living, plants lack the power of locomotion due to them being a rooted structure.

If you are looking for industrial plant, it goes under the name of [[factory]]. For the Nuclear Throne character see [[plant (nuclear throne)]].

title: pamonha
body: Pamonha is a traditional [[Brazil]]ian delicacy made from fresh grated corn. The mixture is blended with sugar or salt (depending on whether it's sweet or savory), and folded into corn husks before being boiled. It’s soft, creamy, and rich in flavor—especially when filled with cheese or sausage. Popular during [[Festa Junina]] celebrations, pamonha is a true comfort food that brings family and festivity to the table.

title: cuscuz
body: Traditional [[Brazil]]ian cuscuz is a staple dish from the Northeast of Brazil, known for its simple ingredients and deep cultural roots. Made primarily from flaked cornmeal, it’s typically moistened with water and a pinch of salt, then steamed in a special mold called a “cuscuzeira”. The result is a warm, fluffy cake that’s both comforting and versatile.

title: festa_junina
body: [[Festa Junina]] is a traditional [[Brazil]]ian festival celebrated in June. It honors Saint John and other Catholic saints, and it’s known for its colorful decorations, folk music, and lively dances like the quadrilha. People dress in rural costumes, wear straw hats, and enjoy typical foods such as [[cuscuz]], [[pamonha]], and canjica. [[Bonfire]]s are lit, fireworks light up the sky, and communities come together to celebrate country life and Brazilian culture.

title: matthias_raoul_gautier
body:
Character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]].

Matthias appears in the flesh in [[Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes]], serving as one of [[Dimitri Alexandre Blaiddyd|King Dimitri]]'s closest advisors along with [[Felix Hugo Fraldarius|Duke Fraldarius]].

Matthias is the father of [[Sylvain Jose Gautier|Sylvain]] and [[Miklan Anschutz Gautier|Miklan]]. As Margrave Gautier, he serves as the lord of one of the foremost territories in the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus; the Gautier lands bordering the nation of Sreng to the north. For years, he wielded the [[Lance of Ruin]] in defense of the Kingdom, warding his land from repeated Sreng attacks. In [i]Three Houses[/i], he eventually cedes the Lance to Sylvain after Miklan dies trying to use it.

Matthias disinherited Miklan over his lack of a Crest in favor of Sylvain, which made Miklan turn to banditry. [spoiler]While the Lance of Ruin is framed as necessary for the defense of Gautier territory, Matthias's actions directly caused Miklan to go down an awful path of tormenting Sylvain and wreaking death and destruction wherever he and his bandits ventured. These events have embittered Sylvain with his father and the Crest system, and are indirectly to blame for Sylvain's philandering ways.[/spoiler]

Matthias has [[short hair|short]] [[red hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. He wears a [[brown armor|brown]] set of [[full armor]] adorned with a [[fur collar]].
other_names: マティアス=ラウル=ゴーティエ

title: skirt
body:
A skirt is a tube- or cone-shaped garment which hangs from the waist and covers all or part of the legs.

A [[dress]] should not be tagged with [[skirt]]. A dress is a one-piece outfit, while a skirt is a separate piece of clothing.

h4. Lengths

* !post #2103079: [[microskirt]] [tn]| Barely covers the crotch.[/tn]
* !post #4572520: [[miniskirt]] [tn]| Around thigh length; mid-thigh or less.[/tn]
* !post #7230292: [[medium skirt]] [tn]| Around knee length; mid-thigh to upper calf.[/tn]
* !post #2823763: [[long skirt]] [tn]| Beyond knee length; upper calf to feet.[/tn]

h5. Waistlines

* !post #1493423: [[lowleg skirt]] [tn]| Low on the hips, often showing the [[hip bones]].[/tn]

title: mercedes_von_martritz
body:
A character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and a member of the Blue Lions.

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] (though she cuts it [[short_hair|short]] after the in-game timeskip), [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

A motherly and religious woman, Mercedes can't ignore people in need, being always prone to help her friends if there's a problem. She tends to let people tell her what to do, rationalizing this to be the will of the Goddess. She is good friends with [[annette_fantine_dominic|Annette]].

In-game, Mercedes is one of the best healers available to the player, being one of only two characters with access to the Fortify spell (the other being [[flayn_(fire_emblem)|Flayn]]). She also does reasonably well with offensive magic, but she has terrible physical stats.

[spoilers]Mercedes's half-brother is [[Jeritza von Hrym]], who was once known as Emile von Bartels. The two were separated when Emile's step-father, Baron Bartels, attempted to dispose of his wife, Mercedes and Jeritza's mother, and force his step-daughter to bear him a child with the power of a Crest. However, his plan was stopped by Jeritza, who killed his father before running away.[/spoilers]

h4. Appearance

* !post #3588635
* !post #8033974: [[mercedes von martritz (timeskip)|Post Timeskip]]
* !post #7643027: [[Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes]]
* !post #4592534: [[mercedes von martritz (summer)|Summer]]
* !post #6790475: [[mercedes von martritz (tea party)|Tea Party]]

title: sweat
body:
Beads of perspiration that form on the body from physical exertion. Use this tag for light sweating (less than 5 drops). For heavy sweating, use [[very sweaty]]. 

For large drops of sweat indicating [[nervous|nervousness]] or [[embarrassed|embarrassment]] in comedic situations, use [[sweatdrop]] or [[comedic sweatdrop]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7515500

h4. See also

* [[flying sweatdrops]]
* [[sweaty clothes]]
* [[sparkling sweat]]
* [[wiping sweat]]
* [[very sweaty]]

[[Nude]] rules still apply: a character can wear legwear or other accessories underneath, as long as they don't cover most of the torso.

title: ogerpon
body:
A Legendary [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]], #1017 in the National Pokédex.

A green, humanoid Pokémon that is exclusively [[1girl|female]]. Has [[yellow eyes]] with [[white pupils|white]], [[star-shaped pupils]], [[fangs]], and a prehensile cloak with [[horns]] on it. Wields a [[spiked club]], most notably when using its signature [[pokemon move|move]], [[Ivy Cudgel (pokemon)|]]. Plays a major role in [[pokemon sv|Pokémon Scarlet and Violet]]'s Teal Mask DLC.

It has four forms, each corresponding to a different [[mask]] it can wear. Each of these forms has a unique appearance when [[Terastallization|Terastallized]].

body:
Bangs that are kept in place by a hand, a [[hairclip]] or another [[hair ornament]], or even a [[hairband]], exposing parts of the forehead.

Compare with [[hair slicked back]], where there is no object blocking the bangs, or [[hair pulled back]], where it's the whole hair, and not just the bangs.

title: aoi_nabi
body:
[[Virtual Youtuber]] persona of [[Nabi (uz02)|]], debuting on May 2, 2021. 

Nabi is a [[butterfly]] who from a young age loved Japanese culture and cute characters. She sports a large silver [[jacket]] that can be taken off to reveal an [[open-chest sweater|open-chest]] [[grey sweater]]. She has dark [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], decorated with various [[hairclip]]s and a large [[butterfly hair ornament]] resting on the left of her head. Behind her ears are also multiple large [[bow earrings]] and on her back she is carrying two oversize [[stylus]] pens.

Speaking in a soft and nervous voice with a surprisingly sharp and upbeat giggle (that sometimes resembles a [[yandere]] laugh); Nabi is an artist skilled at drawing, singing and can speak Korean and Japanese, as well as small amounts of English that she has been studying. She likes cute things, enjoys listening to music and looking at other illustrations. Her favorite food is "Shabu shabu":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shabu-shabu that she claims to try to eat at least once a week. Nabi's favorite color is blue but she dislikes bugs, greasy food and loud noises.

While appeared reserved at first, Nabi would eventually revealed her "wild" sides a month after her debut by hosting a Korean swear word lesson stream and teaching her fans about various vulgar words in Korean. She's also a personal friend of a fellow artist-vtuber [[Ayamy (vtuber)|]] who gets along with her surprisingly well.

She was the main designer for [[Watson Amelia]], [[Amatsuka Uto]], [[Shiratori Rena]], [[Himukai Kogane]], [[Tomo (maesond)|]], as well as the artist for [[Alice Mana]]'s redesign, thus she is known by her fans as "Nabi-mama" and "Nabi-sensei". Nabi's official name for her fans are [b]Nabigators[/b].

Her emoji is 🦋 (a butterfly - her pen name "Nabi" means butterfly in Korean). Her birthday is May 24th. Her rigging was done by [[qquack]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #4464727

h4. External links

* "Youtube channel":https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCzKkwB84Y0ql0EvyOWRSkEw
* "Main Illustration Twitter":https://twitter.com/nabiseedling

title: alabama_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the USS [i]Alabama[/i] (BB-60) in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Enka (bcat)|]], voiced by [[Yamamura Hibiku (voice Actor)|]].

Alabama has [[very long hair|very long]], [[white hair]] tied up into [[twintails]], [[red eyes]], and [[dark skin]]. She has some [[body markings]] on her abdomen right below her [[large breasts|breasts]] and around her pelvis, as well as some [[whisker markings|whisker-like]] [[facial_mark|facial markings]]. She wears a white [[bandeau]]-style [[tube top]] with [[clothes writing|"ALBM" printed on it]], while wearing a black bikini top underneath, along with a [[detached collar]]. She wears black [[short shorts]] and a [[long coat|long]], [[open coat|open]], [[white coat]] with tattered fringes and a cyan inner lining. In addition, she wears [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], similarly styled [[black thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[sneakers]]

Her [[rigging]] is a spider-like construction supporting her three triple-barrel [[ship turret|turrets]], as well as straight steel plates with triangular tips, painted to resemble hulls. Most notably of course, is her large, red [[scythe]] with [[anchor|anchors]] attached by [[chain|chains]] and a [[radar dish]] on the hilt.

h4. Skins

* !post #3582854: Default
* !post #5994870: [[alabama (untarnished silver silken gold) (azur lane)|Untarnished Silver, Silken Gold]]

title: saruyume
body: A [[Japanese urban legends|Japanese urban legend]] from [[2channel]]. This story is a dream the narrator has where they’re sitting on a mostly empty train, but the stations are unusual names like "minced meat" or "eye-gouging" which is what happens to the unfortunate passengers behind them... and they're next. The narrator usually wakes up by this time but receives a warning that the next time they have the dream would be the last.

title: kira_yoshikage
body:
The main antagonist of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 4, [[Diamond wa Kudakenai]].

A serial killer who uses his [[Stand (Jojo)|]], [[Killer Queen]], to kill beautiful women for their hands, which he finds extremely attractive. He typically dresses in a [[suit]] with a distinctive skull-print [[necktie]] (example: post #404241).

[spoiler]After his identity is revealed to the main cast, he manages to switch all his identifying features with those of [[Kawajiri Kosaku]] and steals his identity.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]He's the protagonist of the spinoff [[Dead Man's Questions]].

title: seaz_(oxxo)
body: This character is an original character by the Korean artist, Oxxo. While initially inspired by the customizable player characters in the MMORPG Blade & Soul, Oxxo has since developed and depicted the character through their unique creative vision. It holds a significant place in Oxxo's illustrations, consistently appearing in their art over an extended period and having developed a distinct identity beyond its in-game origins.

title: manuela_casagranda
body:
A character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], a [[mole_under_eye|mole under her left eye]], and [[large breasts]].

A former opera diva and a teacher at Garreg Mach Monastery. Manuela is constantly searching for someone to marry, but her messy habits drive away many potential suitors. She and [[Dorothea Arnault]] are former colleagues from their time at the Mittelfrank Opera Company in Enbarr.

h4. Appearance

title: coraline_jones
body:
The protagonist of the [[Coraline]] novel by [[Neil Gaiman]] and its film adaptation.
She is a feisty and curious adventurer who moved from Pontiac, Michigan with her parents to the Pink Palace Apartments in Ashland, Oregon. With her parents perpetually working and offering little attention to her, Coraline becomes increasingly bored and neglected and thus, decides to become an explorer of their new living location.

title: hngis
body: *H₂n̥gʷʰis is a reconstructed Proto-Indo-European term meaning 'serpent', as well as a possible name for a mythological entity, polycephalous sea serpent or dragon which was slain by a hero named Trito with the help of the god Perkʷunos.

title: hanzo_(world_heroes)
body:
[b]Hanzo Hattori Masanari[/b] (服部 半蔵, [i]Hattori Hanzō[/i]) is the protagonist of the [[World Heroes]] competitive fighting [[video game]] series. 

Hanzo is based on the [[Japan]]ese historical figure of the same name, who was head of a [[ninja]] clan in Iga and was born in August 10, 1555.

He is [[fuuma_kotarou_(world_heroes)|Fuuma Kotarou]]'s rival. In his initial planning stages, he bore a very striking resemblance to Ryu from Street Fighter. Hanzo's hairstyle and padded outfit were devised to give his design its own uniqueness. His IQ from his World Heroes profile is listed as unfathomable.
other_names: ハンゾウ(ワールドヒーローズ)

title: dyeus_phter
body:
*Dyḗus (lit. 'daylight'), also *Dyḗus ph₂tḗr (lit. 'father daylight'), is the reconstructed name of the daylight-sky god in Proto-Indo-European mythology. *Dyēus was conceived as a divine personification of the bright sky of the day and the seat of the gods, the *deywṓs. Associated with the vast diurnal sky and with the fertile rains, *Dyēus was often paired with *Dʰéǵʰōm, the Earth Mother, in a relationship of union and contrast.

While its existence is not directly attested by archaeological or written materials, *Dyēus is considered by scholars the most securely reconstructed deity of the Indo-European pantheon, as identical formulas referring to him can be found among the subsequent Indo-European languages and myths of the Vedic Indo-Aryans, Latins, Greeks, Phrygians, Messapians, Thracians, Illyrians, Albanians and Hittites.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/*Dyēus

title: kickboxing
body:
Kickboxing is a stand-up combat sports and a form of [[boxing]] based on [[Karate]] and [[Muay Thai]]. The combat takes place in a [[boxing ring]], normally with boxing gloves, mouthguards, shorts, similar with classical boxing sport, albeit the participant is [[barefoot]] to favor the use of kicks.

While very similar to [[Muay Thai]], kickboxing can be distinguished by the more "standardized" boxing kits similar to classical [[boxing]] and the lack of special Muay Thai techniques that are forbidden in kickboxing rules such as elbow or knee strikes.

title: impero_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of [i]Impero[/i], an unfinished [i]Littorio[/i]-class battleship.
Character design by [[Baizu (guszx)|]].

She has [[very long hair|]] [[pink hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit includes a [[black dress|black]]/[[white dress|white]] [[short dress|short]] [[two-tone dress|dress]] that has a [[collared dress|collar]], shows a bit of [[cleavage]] of Impero's [[medium breasts]] and has a [[cutout above navel]]. She also wears long [[white cloak|white]] and [[green cloack]] decorated with [[aiguillette]] and lion [[badge]] with [[italian flag]]. Her feet are covered with [[white boots|white]] [[high heel boots|boots]] [[fold-over boots]] with [[gold trim]].

In real life, she was the fourth and final [i]Littorio[/i]-class battleship but ended up unfinished due to repeated evacuations between bases and Italy's eventual armistice with the Allies. According to declassified and published Italian archival documents, she was to be converted into an aircraft carrier that would also carry V-1 missiles. Captured by the Germans, she was used as a target ship before sustaining further damage from Allied air raids. She was later towed to Venice for scrapping by the end of the 1940s.

title: kune-kune
body:
くねくね ([i]Kune-kune[/i], an onomatopoeia meaning "wiggle-waggle") is a [[Japanese urban legends|Japanese urban legend]] that has been going around the Internet since 2003. In this scary story appears an unidentifiable being.

Although the story has a number of patterns, the most representative storyline is the one where "the narrator wanders around the countryside in the summer, near a paddy field or a river, and sees a white thing that wiggles its body in a manner far different from that of any person or living creature. He asks his companion what that thing might be. His friend uses binoculars in order to verify the actual shape of the thing, and as soon as he understands what it is, his mouth seizes up with fear and he becomes insane."

The locals know that "when you see the wiggle-waggle, once you understand what it is, it has an abnormal effect on your soul," and they regard it as taboo. In the stories, sometimes there can be a warning from the local elders who say "if you see such a thing, you should not get close; you should quickly forget you ever saw it."

Not to be mistaken for the visually similar [[Hattifattener]] from The [[Moomin]]s.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kunekune_%28Yokai%29
* ”It’s better if you don’t know” "[Original Japanese]":[http://syarecowa.moo.jp/6/212.htm] "[English translation]":[http://sharekowa.tumblr.com/post/87647754633/its-better-if-you-dont-know] - The probable earliest origin of the stories, posted on a [[2channel]] thread in July 2001. At that time  the creature had no name.

title: teke-teke
body:
[[Japanese urban legends|Japanese urban legend]] about a schoolgirl who became a vengeful spirit after having the bottom half of her body sliced off by a train (right across the middle of the torso). Variants as to how that happened include getting tied to the tracks by school bullies, or being pushed, or just a simple accidental fall. 

Without her legs, the Teke-Teke can 'only' move by dragging herself along with her upper arms, causing a distinctive "teke-teke" scratching noise from which she gets her name. Some variants have her 'walk' by using her arms as legs, but she usually still makes that scratching noise.

The Teke-Teke's modus operandi is to ambush isolated victims at night to slice them in half across the torso (emulating her death). This is often done with a Grim Reaper-style scythe. 

The Teke-Teke is usually depicted as a girl in a Japanese [[school uniform|schoolgirl uniform]] (often bloodied) with her lower half missing. Some depictions will also have an exposed lower spine jutting out at where her torso was cut in half. The Teke-Teke is usually armed with a [[scythe]], or less commonly, a long [[knife]] or some other bladed weapon.

When written in Japanese, the Teke-Teke creepypasta/character is almost always written in katakana, as テケテケ.

h4. See also

* [b]Sacchan[/b]
** Almost identical urban legend, except without the "teke-teke" onomatopoeia.
** Always spelled in katakana (サッチャン) when referring to the urban legend.
* [b]Kashima-san/Kashima Reiko[/b]
** Related, older urban legend of a dismembered vengeful spirit. 
** Some variants have Kashima committing suicide by throwing herself onto the train tracks (after being raped by American soldiers), meeting a similar fate as the Teke-Teke. This version is sometimes regarded as the origin of the Teke-Teke creepypasta.
** Always spelled in katakana (カシマさん、カシマレイコ) when referring to the urban legend.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Teke Teke":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teke_Teke]

title: mary-san
body:
Evil entity that appeared(?) in a [[Japanese urban legends|Japanese modern ghost story/urban legend]], メリーさんの電話 (Phone calls from Mary-san). It was adapted into a 2011 film. 

An abandoned doll terrorizing her previous owner with phone calls from slowly advancing points before calling the last time that she's right behind the owner. 

This short & nice story is also notorious for its countless joke variants.

title: kuchisake-onna
body:
An old [[Japanese urban legends|Japanese legend-turned-urban legend]] of a woman who had her face cut up (either by her husband or by failed plastic surgery), and her [[ghost]] haunts young people. 

She wears a face mask and asks people if she looks pretty. 

If they answer "No" she immediately kills them with a scythe or scissors. If they answer "Yes", she takes the mask off, revealing her horribly cut face, and asks "How about now?", before killing them

In other versions of the tale she says "Wanna know how I became like this?" after taking the mask off, and cuts the face of the victim making them look like her (especially if they are young women).

There are supposedly two ways of escaping her. One is responding "You are somewhat attractive to me" or just "So so", which may confuse the ghost and give you time to escape. The other way is by repeating everything she says, which may cause her to disappear. 

h4. See also

* [[Glasgow smile]]

title: creepypasta
body:
Urban legends or scary stories circulating on the Internet, many times revolving around specific videos, pictures or video games. The term "creepypasta" is a mutation of the term "copypasta": a short, readily available piece of text that is easily copied and pasted into a text field. "Copypasta" is derived from "copy/paste", and in its original sense commonly referred to presumably initially sincere text (e.g. a blog or forum post) perceived by the copy/paster as undesirable or otherwise preposterous, which was then copied and pasted to other sites as a form of trolling.

(Source: Wikipedia)

h4. Examples of creepypastas

* [[Ben Drowned]]
* [[Jeff the Killer]]
* [[Slender Man]]
* The [[Backrooms (creepypasta)|]]
* [[Sonic.exe]]

h4. See also

title: glenn_fraldarius
body:
Background character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]].

[b]Glenn Govan Fraldarius[/b] was [[Felix Hugo Fraldarius]]'s elder brother, and the elder son of [[Rodrigue Achille Fraldarius]]. He was also engaged to [[Ingrid Brandl Galatea]].

Glenn served as a knight in service to [[Dimitri Alexandre Blaiddyd|Crown Prince Dimitri of Faerghus]] until he gave his life to protect Dimitri in the Tragedy of Duscur. The effects of his untimely death still linger, and all those closest to him — Rodrigue, Felix, Ingrid and Dimitri — have been trying to process his passing all in their own ways. Whereas Rodrigue and Ingrid are proud to know he died the ideal knight, Dimitri considers his death a senseless one, and Felix has grown disgusted with the glorification of his brother's death to the point of forswearing chivalric ideals altogether.

Glenn has never been seen, so any depictions of him are artistic guesses as to his appearance. He is usually depicted with the same [[dark blue hair]] as his kin and the same [[blue eyes]] as his father. It is unknown whether Glenn bore the Crest of Fraldarius in any capacity.
other_names: グレン=ゴーヴァン=フラルダリウス

body:

[spoilers]The real Cornelia Arnim was killed years before the events of the story and replaced by a member of Those Who Slither In The Dark named [[Cleobulus (Fire Emblem)|]]. title: breaking_bad
body:
An American crime drama television series. It tells the story of [[Walter White]], a high school chemistry teacher diagnosed with cancer, who, along with his former student [[Jesse Pinkman]], turns to a life of crime, producing and selling crystal meth to secure his family's financial future before he dies.

In 2020, the show has gained [[meme]]tic status, primarily due to the "Breaking Good" shitposting video made by Youtuber Jixaw. Various aspects of the show has since intergreated into wider meme culture and spawned several memes in the process.

h4. See also
* [[Better Call Saul]]
* [[Los Pollos Hermanos]]
* [[Huell rolling in money (meme)]]
* [[Jesse what the fuck are you talking about (meme)]]
* [[My name is Skyler White yo (meme)]]
* [[Walter White breaks down (meme)]]
* [[Walter White cooking (meme)]]
* [[Walter White screaming in car (meme)]]

title: heaven's_door
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Kishibe Rohan]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as a short humanoid with a bowtie and hat.

Its power allows Rohan to view a person's memories as if he were reading a book made from their body. Rohan can write commands in this book, which the target will unconsciously obey. He can also tear out a page, erasing the memories contained on it from the target's mind. He can't use his Stand to read his own "pages", but can use to write commands on them.

Its namesake is the Bob Dylan song "Knockin' on Heaven's Door".

title: ghost_pose
body:
Posing like a [[ghost]], with the arms held up, elbows bent, and the hands limply hanging down in front of the body.

h4. Examples

* !post #9042530
* !post #7654024

h4. See also

* [[claw pose]] (palm outward, fingers curled)
* [[paw pose]] (hands closed in loose)
* [[zombie pose]] (arms straight)
* [[Tag Group:Posture]]

title: zombie_pose
body:
Posing like a stereotypical [[zombie]] or [[jiangshi]], with the arms held [[outstretched arms|outstreched]] away from the body, and the hands hanging limply downward.

Not to be confused with [[ghost pose]], which has bent elbows and the hands closer to the body.

h4. Examples

* !post #6379997

h4. See also

* [[claw pose]] (palm outward, fingers curled)
* [[ghost pose]] (elbows bent up)
* [[paw pose]] (elbows bent up, hands closed in loose)
* [[reaching]] (hands open to grab)
* [[Thriller (michael jackson)|]]
* [[Tag Group:Posture]]

body: Original character by [[Komone Ushio]].

title: claw_pose
body:
A hand pose imitating [[claws]].

Stereotypically the hands are held up near the face, with the fingers arched and curled inwards.

Usually an imitation of animal behavior. More rarely, it may be part of a [[fighting stance]], or an intent to grab.

h4. Examples

* !post #5657329: One hand
* !post #8368129: Both hands

h4. See also

* [[Ghost pose]] (hands limp)
* [[Paw pose]] (hands closed in loose)
* [[Zombie pose]] (arms straight, hands limp)
* [[Tag group:Gestures]]

title: character.ai
body:
A generative [[artificial intelligence|AI]] chatbot service where users can communicate with chatbots created by themselves or other users of the site. While the majority are based on fictional characters, others are based on [[real life]] figures or designed to be fully [[original]] characters.

title: the_grim_adventures_of_billy_&_mandy
body: The Grim Adventures of Billy & Mandy is an American animated television series created by Maxwell Atoms for [[Cartoon Network]]. It follows [[billy (grim adventures)|Billy]], an extremely dimwitted, happy-go-lucky boy, and [[mandy (grim adventures)|Mandy]], a cynical, remorseless girl, who, after winning a limbo game to save Billy's pet hamster, gains [[Grim (grim adventures)|]], the mighty [[Grim Reaper]], as their "best friend forever". Grim, who is reluctant to serve the two children, has access to supernatural items, spells, and other abilities that often lead Billy and Mandy to interact with otherworldly environments, characters, or situations.
other_names: ヘクター・コンカルネ編

title: help:blacklists
body:
[b]Blacklists[/b] are a way to hide posts containing tags you don't want to see.

To edit your blacklist, go to your "account settings":[/settings] under [b]My Account[/b] >> [b]Settings[/b] >> [b]Basic[/b]. You'll have to "create an account":[/users/new] if you don't have one already. In the [b]Blacklisted tags[/b] box, add the list of tags you want to hide.

Blacklisted posts are hidden during searches. When posts are hidden, a Blacklist box will appear in the sidebar showing you how many posts were hidden. You can click the tags under the Blacklist section to toggle individual rules, or click the toggle at the top of the box to toggle all rules at once. You can choose to blur blacklisted posts rather than hiding them entirely by clicking the three dots on the Blacklist box, then selecting Blur images.

[[help:safe mode|Safe mode]] is another option if you just want to hide non-{{rating:general}} posts.

h4. Examples

Each rule goes on a separate line:

[code]
yaoi
futanari
guro
spoilers
[/code]
This will hide all posts that are tagged either [[yaoi]], [[futanari]], [[guro]], or [[spoilers]].

If you put multiple tags on one line, then only posts that have [b]all[/b] the tags will be hidden:

[code]
yaoi guro
[/code]

This will only hide posts that are tagged both [[yaoi]] and [[guro]]. Posts that are tagged only [[yaoi]] or only [[guro]] will still be visible.

[code]yaoi 2boys
1boy[/code]

This will hide all posts that are tagged both tag [[yaoi]] and [[2boys]], also hide [[1boy]].

h6. NOT operator

The [code]-[/code] symbol is the NOT operator. It lets you hide posts that [b]don't[/b] have certain tags.

[code]
nude 1boy -1girl -multiple_girls
[/code]

This will hide all posts that are tagged [[nude]] and [[1boy]], but only if they don't have the tags [[1girl]] or [[multiple girls]].

h6. OR operator

The [code]~[/code] symbol is the OR operator. It lets you hide posts that have [b]any[/b] of the given tags.

[code]
~1boy ~2boys
[/code]

is the same as:

[code]
1boy
2boys
[/code]

This can also be used to group together multiple complex rules into a single rule:

[code]
1boy -1girl -multiple_girls
2boys -1girl -multiple_girls
[/code]

is the same as

[code]
~1boy ~2boys -1girl -multiple_girls
[/code]

h6. Metatags

There are a few special commands, known as metatags, that can be used to blacklist things other than regular tags:

* {{rating:explicit}}
* {{rating:questionable}}
* {{rating:sensitive}}
* {{rating:general}}
* {{status:pending}}
* {{status:flagged}}
* {{status:deleted}}
* {{score:<-5}} ([i]only less-than comparisons allowed[/i])
* uploaderid:1234 ([i]must be a user id[/i])

h6. Limitations

Wildcards are not allowed within blacklists. For example, using {{*boys}} to match the {{2boys}}, {{3boys}}, etc., tags won't work.

h4. Default Blacklists

The following blacklist is automatically set for logged out users and new users:

[code]
guro
scat
furry -rating:g
[/code]

h4. See also

* [[help:user settings]]
* [[help:safe mode]]

title: gates_capa
body:
A fictional antagonist character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. He first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] anime TV series from 1985.

[b]Gates Capa[/b] is a [[Titans (gundam)|]] [[Mobile Suit]] [[pilot]] and flight officer. He is also a Cyber-Newtype (an artificially created Newtype). 

Gates' MS of choice is the [[Baund Doc]].

He also appears in [[Gundam GQuuuuuux]], where he pilots a [[Hambrabi]].

title: gundam_uc_0099:_moon_crisis
body:
[b]Mobile Suit Gundam in UC 0099: Moon Crisis[/b] ([i]Kidou Senshi Gundam: Moon Crisis[/i]) was a Universal Century [[Gundam]] manga series originally serialized in the magazine [[MS SAGA]] from 1993 to 1994, it was compiled into a compilation volume by Media Works. It was later reissued as two volumes by Dengeki Comics in November 1997 and January 1998. 

Taking place in an altered interpretation of the Universal Century, Moon Crisis is set in the same time-line of [[Outer Gundam]] and [[Mobile Suit Gundam REON]], which were written by the same author.

h4. Some characters

* [[Doctor]] [[Kamille Bidan]]
other_names: 機動戦士ガンダムムーンクライシス

title: toilet_sink_combo
body:
A [[toilet]] with a small [[sink]] built into the top or lid of the cistern (aka the toilet tank).  These sinks operate by drawing some of the clean water going into the cistern and diverting it to the faucet so people can wash their hands.  The used water then enters the cistern from the sink.  These sinks are directly tied to the toilet's flushing mechanism, so automatically run after flushing and shut off when the cistern is filled.

h4.See also

* [[Bathroom]]

title: quran_(object)
body:
The Quran (ٱلْقُرْآن‎), is the [[book]] containing central religious text of [[Islam]], believed by Muslims to be a revelation directly from God revealed by prophet [[Muhammad]]. It is organized in 114 chapters which consist of individual verses.

For art based on the Quran or characters which appear in it, see [[The Quran]].

title: shiiko_sugai's_son
body:

The very little son of [[Shiiko Sugai]] who looks a lot like her.

title: body_armor
body:
Any form of modern protective gear that is worn over a person's body for protection against melee attacks (e.g. [[stab]]s), [[arrow (projectile)|arrows]], bullets, shrapnel, or frags. and Typically worn by [[military]] [[soldier|personnel]], military operators, [[police]] officers, [[security guard]]s, [[combat medic]]s and [[reporter]]s/journalists in [[battlefield|warzones]], sometimes worn by [[bodyguard]]s.

Notable examples are Kevlar [b][[bulletproof vest]]s[/b], [b]plate carriers[/b] that can contain ballistic plates, [b][[flak jacket]]s[/b], and the bulky [b][[bomb suit]]s[/b].

If the armor looks archaic or [[medieval]], use [b][[armor]][/b] instead.

title: tsukitsuki!
body:
Tsuki Tsuki! is a romantic comedy light novel series written by Yuujin Goto and illustrated by Riko Korie, which began publication in 2010; in 2013, the series went on hiatus. The series focuses on Shinobu's daily life with his Unwanted Harem. Some supernatural stuff is involved, but the series mainly deals about Shinobu's daily life.

One day Shinobu Nanjou wakes up, just to find a naked blonde girl sleeping besides him. He has no memory whatsoever of her. Who is she? Why is she in his bed? Why is she naked? To make matters worse, his sister comes in and sees them. What will happen now?

title: hasu_no_sora_school_uniform
body:
The uniform of the Hasu no Sora Girls' High School from [[Link! Like! Love Live!]].

The [[winter uniform]] consists of a [[medium dress|medium-length]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[pleated dress|pleated]] [[brown dress|brown]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[white sailor collar|white]] [[sailor collar]], a [[neckerchief]] with the color indicating the grade of the student (rotating between [[red neckerchief|red]], [[aqua neckerchief|aqua]], and [[yellow neckerchief|yellow]]) and [[brown shoes|brown]] [[loafers]]. In school, they wear color-coded [[uwabaki]] matching their neckerchief. In especially cold days, students may wear a [[black coat|black]] [[collared coat]] over their uniform. 

The [[summer uniform]] instead features a [[puffy short sleeves|puffy short-sleeved]] [[blue dress|blue-ish]] [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[breast pocket]] on the wearer's left. 

Note that in live performances, the cast usually wear only the skirt part of the winter uniform along with a themed t-shirt in encores.

Unlike the other entries of Love Live!, they don't change their neckerchiefs to other colors when they move up a class. 

h4. Examples
* !post #7452192: Winter uniform
* !post #7515584: Black collared coat
* !post #7503740: Summer uniform
* !post #8734082: Live shirt example

* [[List of Uniforms]]

title: peachyboo
body:
A transformation of a common [[Boo (mario)|]] using the [[Super Crown]], similar to [[Bowsette]].

Very similar to [[King Boo]]'s [[Princess King Boo]] transform, but typically humbler, child-like and smaller.

Tag only if:
* Image shows a regular boo as the base form.
* Author says it is a [b]regular[/b] boo or [b]not a King Boo[/b] transform.[br]Merely saying “Boo” does not suffice, as the nuance is often lost.
* Part of a batch of minion transforms.

title: popsicle
body:
Also known as [b]Ice pop[/b], [b]ice lolly[/b], [b]ice block[/b], [b]ice drop[/b], [b]ice gola[/b], or [b]ice candy[/b].
A frozen, flavored, ice-based snack on a stick.

It is often portrayed [[melting]] and [[dripping]] in the [[hot|heat]] while a character [[eating|eats]] it, sometimes in a [[sexually suggestive]] manner.

On Danbooru it is used for generic ice pops, not necessarily for the "Popsicle":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Popsicle_%28brand%29 name brand.

title: higashikata_josuke_(jojolion)
body:
Josuke Higashikata (東方 定助, Higashikata Jōsuke) is the main protagonist of the eighth part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[JoJolion]], and the eighth JoJo of the series.

Wears a [[dixie cup hat]] and sailor clothes, [[sneakers]], [[peace symbol]] and [[anchor print]] on shirt and has a distinct [[tooth gap|gap in his teeth]]. He has [[Joestar birthmark]], [spoilers]which he received from [[Kira Yoshikage (JoJolion) | Kira Yoshikage]][/spoilers].
[spoiler]
He is a fusion of [[Kira Yoshikage (JoJolion) | Kira Yoshikage]] and [[Kujo Josefumi]]. [/spoilers]

Josuke is a [[Stand (jojo)|]] user and retains an upgraded version of  [[Soft & Wet]].

title: borrowed_character
body:
When an artist draws an [[original]] character which was originally created by a different artist.

If an artist draws his own original character(s) with the borrowed character(s), or draws borrowed character(s) from more than one artist, also tag [[crossover]].

This also covers works where artist draws a stolen original character from another artist, where artist copied the design of other artist's OC and labelled as their own. In this case, tag that said original character with the name given by the original artist.

Note that "描いてもいいのよ":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/描いてもいいのよ is not supposed to indicate a borrowed character. It is supposed to be used to indicate the original artist is fine with others drawing their character. 

h4. See also

* [[borrowed design]]
* pool #1338 (Popular Artists Draw Other Copyrights)
other_names: 描かせていただきました

body:

If the character is using an actual bucket as a hat, use [[bucket on head]]. Do not confuse with [[pith helmet]], a hard downward-sloping cotton hat stereotypically associated with safaris, or [[boonie hat]], a very similar hat worn by some types of infantry soldier.

body:

[spoilers]Tooru wields the automatic [[Stand (jojo)|]] [[Wonder of U]], which causes anyone attempting to pursue either itself or Tooru to suffer a calamity.[/spoilers]

He is recognizable by his [[teddy bear]]s on his sleeves, and the swirly symbols on his shirt and [[afro]].

He is also the childhood friend of [[Hirose Yasuho]] and harbors feelings for her.

Namesake is the song "Paisley Park" by Prince and The Revolution, released as a single on 24 May 1985 and on the album [i]Around the World in a Day[/i] on 22 April 1985.

title: muhammad
body:
Muhammad (مُحَمَّد‎) (c. 570 – 8 June 632 CE) was an Arab [[religion|religious]] and political leader and the founder of modern-day Islam. He is believed to be the Seal of the Prophets (the last messenger) in [[Islam]]. Along with the [[Quran (object)|]], his teachings and normative examples form the basis for Islamic religious belief.

While the Quran does not explicitly ban depictions of Muhammad, the practice is widely discouraged and considered offensive by many Muslims due to interpretations of the Hadith and concerns about idolatry, akin to the austere aniconism of the Reformed tradition of Christianity.

h4. See also
* [[Tag Group:People]]

[spoiler]He eventually becomes fused with [[Kujo Josefumi]] in order to become [[Higashikata Josuke (jojolion)|]].[/spoiler]

title: ringo_roadagain
body:
Ringo Roadagain is a secondary antagonist featured in the seventh part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[Steel Ball Run]].
Ringo is a man average build. He has light hair passing his forehead, swept to his left; a [[long mustache|long]], [[thick mustache]], a [[soul patch]] in the shape of a cartoonish [[skull]], and a [[beard]] of two slim patches bordering his chin.
He wears a light [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[jacket]] with a high [[popped collar]], dark [[gloves]] revealing his thumbs and index fingers, and a [[wristwatch]] of a fine, modern design on his right. It's shown that his pants are lightly frilled and studded near the bottom of the legs.
As a gunman, Ringo also wields a [[revolver]] (1874 Colt) with an assorted [[ammunition belt]] and [[holster]].

He's a [[stand (jojo)|]] user and his [[stand (jojo)|]] is [[Mandom (stand)|]].

Namesake:
Ringo Starr (Former The Beatles drummer)
On the Road Again (Willie Nelson song).

title: catch_the_rainbow
body:
Stand power of [[Blackmore]], from [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Catch the Rainbow takes the appearance of a mask with three colored stripes similar to that of a simplified [[rainbow]], along with four mouth slits.

"Catch the Rainbow":[https://jojo.fandom.com/wiki/Catch_the_Rainbow] allows the user to use the rain in various ways. Whether that be melding with it and making your body parts dissappear and materialize. Or stabilizing raindrops in the air for mobility purposes, and or to create an area where the raindrops act as an offensive and defensive barrier. Although this stand can deploy very powerful abilities, it cannot work if there is no rain present.

Its namesake is the [[Rainbow (band)|]] song [i]Catch the Rainbow[/i].

title: jodio_joestar
body:
Jodio Joestar (ジョディオ・ジョースター, Jodio Jōsutā) is the main protagonist of the ninth part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[The JOJOLands]], and the ninth JoJo of the series.
Jodio is a small-time gangster with his older brother [[Dragona Joestar]] and his mother [[Barbara Ann Joestar]]. He is a [[Stand (jojo)|]] user who wields [[November Rain (stand)|]], allowing him to create localized drops of rain that can crush his opponents.
 Jodio is a 15-year-old boy. He has light skin and light-colored hair with [[long bangs]] partially obscuring both of his eyes and an undercut at the back. His hair is asymmetrical, as the right [[side braided]] with a [[star hair ornament]] [[hairclip]] attached, and the left side is cut just below his eye. He wears a large "JO" shaped [[earrings|earring]] that hangs from his left ear. As a descendant of the Joestar family, Jodio has the [[Joestar birthmark| Star Birthmark]] on his left shoulder.
His outfit consists of a light [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] shirt under dark [[hooded overalls]] with a [[wing ornament|winged]] [[heart ornament]] at the center of the chest. The emblem is marked by an hourglass symbol with both triangles split into a dark and a bright half, and the shirt has been shown to have the word "NOVEMBER" written on the front collar. The overalls bears a strong resemblance to a life preserver, having a belt fastened around the chest under the heart emblem, sporting rigid light-colored [[shoulder pads]], and exposing most of Jodio's back. The overalls are also fastened to the shirt by two buttons at the back of the waist. The overalls' pantlegs are split under the knee, giving them a similar appearance to [[bell-bottoms]], both also studded in a vertical column besides the slit.
He also has [[armbands]] shaped like two triangles wrapped around each bicep and [[fingerless gloves]] or [[bridal gauntlets]]. Jodio wears dark plain dress shoes.
As an eleven year old, Jodio wore almost the exact same style of clothing. Rather than the heart emblem, his hoodie had "JO" written in large centered letters with the top line of the J being elongated.
other_names: ジョディオ・ジョースター

title: higashikata_josuke
body:
The main protagonist of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 4: [[Diamond wa Kudakenai]]. He is the illegitimate son of [[Joseph Joestar (old)|]] and [[Higashikata Tomoko]]. His [[stand_(jojo)|Stand]] is [[Crazy Diamond]].

Sports a large [[pompadour]] hairstyle, which he is fiercely protective of. His [[gakuran]] is often seen with [[brooch|brooches]] in the shapes of an [[anchor symbol]], a [[heart]], and a [[peace symbol]].

The "助" (suke) in his given name can also be read "jo". The Kanji in Higashikata (東方) can also be read as "Touhou", meaning "Eastern". So Jousuke's name can mean "Eastern JoJo".

title: dire_(jojo)
body:
A minor character from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 1. Best known for his hamon technique, the [[Thunder Cross Split Attack]], which gained popularity due to its use in memes.

title: straizo
body:
Character from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. A hamon master and minor ally of [[Jonathan Joestar]] in Part 1. Becomes an antagonist in Part 2 after gaining vampiric powers via the [[Stone Mask (jojo)|]] to gain eternal youth.

[spoiler]After the events of Part 1, it's revealed that he raised the girl who would later be known as the hamon master [[Lisa Lisa]] in Part 2.[/spoiler]

Namesake is the rock band [[Dire Straits]] (along with [[Dire (jojo)|]]).

title: robert_e._o._speedwagon
body:
A supporting character from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Parts 1 and 2. Originally a street thug, he becomes allies with [[Jonathan Joestar]] during the events of Part 1. Between Parts 1 and 2, Speedwagon becomes a successful oil tycoon. His "Speedwagon Foundation" assists the Joestar family for generations to come.

Namesake is the American rock band REO Speedwagon.
other_names: ロバート・E・O・スピードワゴン

title: monochrome
body:
An image drawn in predominantly one color. It doesn't have to be just black and white; it could be another color such as [[sepia]], [[red theme|red]], [[blue theme|blue]], [[green theme|green]], etc.

If the image uses more than just black and white and uses more shades of grey, also tag with [[greyscale]]. For non-[[greyscale]] monochrome pictures, add the appropriate color tag, such as [[red theme]], [[blue theme]], [[green theme]] etc.

[[Monochrome]] and [[partially colored]] are mutually exclusive. For monochrome pictures with just a bit of color, use [[monochrome]] and [[spot color]] together. If the image has a range of colors but appears grayed out or washed out, see [[muted color]] and [[pale color]].

[[Comic]]s and [[doujinshi]] are often monochrome.

h4. Examples

* !post #5785450: [[Greyscale]]
* !post #5761420: [[Sepia]]
* !post #16212: [[Red theme]]

h4. Colors

* [[greyscale]]
* [[sepia]]

* [[brown theme]]

title: necrozma
body:
A Legendary [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]], #0800 in the National Pokédex.

Shares many similarities with the "Ultra Beasts":https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Ultra_Beast, though it is not usually considered to be one itself.

In its [[necrozma (normal)|base form]], it has a black, [[prism]]-like body, [[large hands]] with long [[claws]], and is usually seen [[floating]]. It can [[fusion|fuse]] with either [[Solgaleo]] or [[Lunala]] to become [[Necrozma (Dusk Mane)|Dusk Mane]] or [[necrozma (dawn wings)|Dawn Wings Necrozma]], respectively. These forms can then use the [[Z-Crystal]] [i]Ultranecrozium Z[/i] to become [[necrozma (ultra)|Ultra Necrozma]].

Japanese name: [b]Necrozma[/b]

h4. Official art
* !post #2542826: [[necrozma (normal)|Necrozma]] [tn](Psychic-type)[/tn]
* !post #9564481: [[necrozma (dusk mane)|Dusk Mane Necrozma]] [tn](Psychic/Steel-type)[/tn]
* !post #9564483: [[necrozma (dawn wings)|Dawn Wings Necrozma]] [tn](Psychic/Ghost-type)[/tn]
* !post #9564485: [[necrozma (ultra)|Ultra Necrozma]] [tn](Psychic/Dragon-type)[/tn]

h4. See also:

* [[Phyco (pokemon)|]], [[Dulse (pokemon)|]], [[Soliera (pokemon)|]], and [[Zossie (pokemon)|]]
* [[Light that Burns the Sky (pokemon)|]], Ultra Necrozma's signature [[Z-Move]].

Prior Pokémon: [[Guzzlord]]
Next Pokémon: [[Magearna]]

title: z-move
body:
A special kind of [[pokemon move|Pokémon move]] usable in [[pokemon sm|Pokémon Sun and Moon]] and [[pokemon usum|Ultra Sun and Moon]]. Using a Z-Move requires both a [[Z-Ring]] and a [[Z-Crystal]]. Before the move is used, the Trainer [[z-move trainer pose|strikes a pose]].

h4. List of Z-Moves
h5. Type-based
* [[Breakneck Blitz (pokemon)|]] (Normal)
* [[All-Out Pummeling (pokemon)|]] (Fighting)

title: dialga
body:
A Steel/Dragon-type Legendary [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]], #0483 in the National Pokédex.

A blue, dinosaur-like creature with some grey metallic portions, such as its chestplate, which has a [[diamond]] in the center. Has [[red eyes]], [[black sclera]]e, a fin-like structure on its back, and a crest on its head. The mascot of [[Pokemon dppt|Pokémon Diamond]] and [[pokemon bdsp|Brilliant Diamond]]; its counterpart is [[Palkia]].

It has the power to control time itself. Alongside Palkia and [[Giratina]], it is a member of the "creation trio." All three were created by [[Arceus]]. The [i]Adamant Crystal[/i] (not to be confused with the [[Adamant Orb]]) allows it to change into its [[dialga (origin)|Origin Forme]].

h4. Official art

title: very_long_ears
body:
When a character's ears are exceptionally long, especially when compared to the rest of their body. Typically, the ears are at least as long as the character's head.

If they're exceptionally long as a joke or [[meme]], they may be [[comically large ears]].

h4. Examples

* !post #9246372

h4. See also

* [[comically large ears]]
* [[long pointy ears]]
* [[pointy ears]]

title: beatrice_(blue_archive)
body: One of the antagonists in [[Blue Archive]] and a member of Gematria. [spoiler]Roughly 10 years prior to the [[Sensei (blue archive)|]]'s arrival, she took over the Arius Branch School following a civil war and turned it towards extremist and nihilistic beliefs. Her ultimate goal is to use [[atsuko_(blue_archive)|Atsuko]] as a sacrifice to summon an unknown, but highly-destructive entity that will lay waste to Kivotos.[/spoiler] She is a [[red skin|red-skinned]] woman with [[long hair|long]], [[black hair]] and a voluptuous figure. Her attire consists of a tight-fitting [[white dress]] and a feathered headpiece with [[extra eyes|a number of eyes]].

title: efreet_custom
body:
[b]MS-08TX[EXAM] Efreet Custom[/b]

A highly modified [b][[Efreet (mobile suit)|]][/b] [[mobile suit]] housing the powerful yet dangerous and unstable EXAM System. It was completely tuned for its pilot, [[Nimbus Schterzen]], sporting two heat swords and arm-mounted grenade launchers as well as missile pods in its legs. 

As additional characteristics, it was painted in his personal colors (dark blue with red shoulders), and the unit's monoeye sensor glowed a bright red when the EXAM System was activated.

title: blue_destiny_01
body:
[b]RX-79BD-1 Blue Destiny-1[/b]

A [[mobile suit]] originated in PS1 game [[Gundam Side Story: The Blue Destiny]].

A highly modified, blue [[Ground Gundam]] housing the powerful yet volatile EXAM System, with a [[GM (Mobile suit)|]] head. Its green visor turns bright red when EXAM was activated, spelling doom for anyone unlucky enough to be in its way.
