title: night_of_the_living_dead
body:
[b]Night of the Living Dead[/b] is a black and white 1968 horror movie directed by George A. Romero. The movie follows a group of survivors who are trapped in a farmhouse in rural Pennsylvania after the dead rise back to life as [[zombie]]s (called [[ghoul]]s in the movie) and attack the living.

Despite the movie's controversy due to its gore and violence at the time, the movie was a hit in the box office and praised by critics due to the movie's criticism of America's society in the 1960s and racism. It also lead to the popularity of zombies in entertainment media. 

As a result of titling error where the movie was never properly copyrighted, the movie is available in the public domain free of use, which resulted in several unofficial sequels and remakes. 

The movie had two official sequels by Romero, [[Dawn of the Dead]], in 1978, which later had a remake by [[Zack Snyder]] in 2004 and [b]Day of the Dead[/b] in 1985, which also had a remake for DVD in 2008. An official remake of the 1968 movie titled, [i]George A. Romero's Night of the Living Dead[/i] was released in 1990, based on a rewritten script of the original movie by Romero. While the movie's plot is still similar to the original, the remake not only had a bigger budget including being filmed in color, it also includes an expanded role for some characters including a new ending.

title: samoyed_(dog)
body:
A Siberian breed of medium-sized white- or cream-colored sled [[dog|dogs]].

[[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Keno (fate)|]] is a Samoyed. In the same game, [[Setanta (fate)|]] is frequently seen accompanied by similar dogs with blue tongues and ears, and [[Cavall ii (fate)|]] is most likely one as well.

title: pomeranian_(dog)
body:
A breed of toy [[dog]] originating from the former Pomerania region (now northern Poland and eastern Germany). They are small-statured and have thick fur colored, brown, white and/or black. They're popular for being the choice dog of Queen Victoria.

[[missile (ghost trick)|Missile]] from [[Ghost Trick]] is a Pomeranian. [[okada izou (fate)|Okada Izou]]'s [[animalization|animalized]] form is [[okada izou (dog) (fate)|a black-furred Pomeranian]].

h4.See also

title: breakout
body:
One of the first popular arcade games, developed by [[Atari]] in 1976 and published by [[Namco]] in Japan. Rows of bricks are destroyed by bouncing a ball against them and the player-controlled paddle. It would later influence [[Arkanoid]].

Additionally, a version that could play in browsers was developed called BakuBlockV74/V77, which would then be used in games where the blocks were that of a girl and her clothes, slowly getting more nude as time went on.

[b]Challia Bull[/b] is a [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] character, a [[Zeon]] soldier and a Newtype who piloted the [[Braw Bro]] [[Mobile Armor]].

While he was a minor character in the original series, he also appears in [[Gundam GQuuuuuuX]] with a major role as the right-hand man of [[Char Aznable]]. title: isabella_i_of_castile
body:
Isabella I (Spanish: Isabel I; 22 April 1451 – 26 November 1504), also called Isabella the Catholic (Spanish: Isabel la Católica), was Queen of Castile and León from 1474 until her death in 1504. She was also Queen of Aragon from 1479 until her death as the wife of King Ferdinand II. Reigning together over a dynastically unified Spain, Isabella and Ferdinand are known as the Catholic Monarchs. Her reign marked the end of Reconquista and also the start of Spanish Empire and dominance of Spain over European Politics for the next century. 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Isabella_I_of_Castile

title: knuckles_the_echidna
body:
[[Sonic the Hedgehog]]'s friend and former rival, Knuckles is a red echidna who gets his name from the spikes on his knuckles. He possesses resilience and strength, and can glide in the air. Because he had to protect the [[Master Emerald]] alone before meeting Sonic and [[tails (sonic)|Tails]], he lacked social abilities and was gullible. He has a fierce rivalry with [[Rouge the Bat]].

His seiyuu is [[Kanna Nobutoshi]].

title: aegir_(mythology)
body:
Ægir (anglicised as Aegir; Old Norse 'sea'), Hlér (Old Norse 'sea'), or Gymir (Old Norse less clearly 'sea, engulfer'), is a jötunn and a personification of the sea in [[Norse mythology]]. In the Old Norse record, Ægir hosts the gods in his halls and is associated with brewing ale. Ægir is attested as married to a goddess, Rán, who also personifies the sea, and together the two produced daughters who personify waves, the Nine Daughters of Ægir and Rán, and Ægir's son is Snær, personified snow. Ægir may also be the father of the beautiful jötunn Gerðr, wife of the god Freyr, or these may be two separate figures who share the same name (see below and Gymir (father of Gerðr)).

One of Ægir's names, Hlér, is the namesake of the island Læsø (Old Norse Hlésey 'Hlér's island') and perhaps also Lejre in Denmark. Scholars have long analyzed Ægir's role in the Old Norse corpus, and the concept of the figure has had some influence in modern popular culture.

title: mario_(series)
body:
Also known as [b]Super Mario[/b] or [b]Super Mario Bros.[/b], the Mario franchise is a series of highly popular and acclaimed video games by [[Nintendo]], featuring Nintendo's mascot Mario and, in many games, his brother Luigi and his best friend Yoshi.

Gameplay in the series often centers around jumping on and defeating enemies. The games usually feature simple plots; the most common theme is that of Bowser, the primary antagonist, kidnapping Princess Peach, whom Mario saves.

Despite the plots usually being very simple, the Mario role-playing games tend to have deeper plots, often involving enemies other than Bowser (many of which involve Bowser actually teaming up with Mario), with aspirations for world domination. Mario and friends have been featured in 200 games, and the series has sold over 200 million copies total, making it the best-selling video game series of all time.

title: tamamo_jk_(fate)
body: A carefree idol who is searching for her legendary Producer (i.e. Master). Makes her first appearance as both an [[official alternate costume]] and a separate character from [[Tamamo no Mae (fate)|]] in the game [[Fate/EXTELLA]]. She wears an [[unbuttoned]] [[school uniform]] with a [[sweater around waist]], similar to [[Jougasaki Mika]]'s normal attire.

title: tamamo_nine
body:
In the [[fate (series)|Fate series]], [[Tamamo (fate)|]] splits eight of her nine tails, and they each wind up gaining sentience and becoming Servants of their own. Each of them wears different colored kimono and has their own signature hairstyle. Aside from [[Tamamo no Mae (fate)|]] herself, only two of the Tamamo Nine have been fully identified: [[Tamamo Cat (fate)|]], the Berserker-class Servant who wears red and represents the original's more pure and sincere aspects, and [[Tamamo Aria (fate)|]], the Rider-class Servant who wears yellow and mirrors what others expect of her. Whether or not [[Tamamo JK (fate)|]] is one of the Tamamo Nine is left ambiguous, and the remaining six have only been seen in asset #24474191, but some of their names and personalities have been revealed:

* Tamamo Vitch, the "talented beautiful secretary"
* Tamamo Gucchi, who likes expensive things
* Tamamo Delmo, the "supremacy of the home"
* Tamamo no Hime, the "noncommittal princess" 

This tag is for images containing any of the Tamamo Nine aside from the original Tamamo no Mae, Tamamo Cat, and Tamamo Aria, especially if their designs are from the sketch referenced above.

Note that due to certain circumstances in [[Fate/Grand Order]], [[Koyanskaya (fate)|]] is referred to as Tamamo Vitch, but this is actually false. For that reason, some images representing the pink-colored Tamamo may be of Koyanskaya, due to them being drawn before the events of the [[Tunguska Sanctuary (fate/grand order)|]] in FGO. (Koyanskaya can be distinguished by her [[animal ears]] being the same pink as her hair [spoiler]as a result of them actually being [[rabbit ears]][/spoiler] whereas the rest of the Tamamo Nine have orange [[fox ears]]. The tag may still apply if she's wearing the distinctive [[off shoulder]] kimono worn by all members of the Tamamo Nine.

If a character [b]only[/b] features [[freckles]] on their breasts, use [[breast freckles]] instead.

The story is an alternate route to [[Fate/Extra CCC]] that focuses on [[Tamamo no mae (fate)|Tamamo no Mae]] as Kishinami Hakuno's servant. It explains the background between Tamamo no Mae and Amaterasu, and the plot includes planned elements for CCC that were cut from the game.

title: tamamo_no_mae_(fate)
body:
Selectable Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/Extra]] and [[Fate/Extra CCC]]. Also one of the Servants of Chaldea in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The "core" (i.e main body) of the "[[Tamamo (fate)|]] nine" servants who were split from [[Amaterasu (fate)|]].

She's a magical [[fox girl]] who uses a [[mirror]] as her [[weapon]], has [[pink hair]], [[yellow eyes]], dressed in stylized traditional blue [[japanese clothes|japanese robes]], often has [[split ponytail]] hairstyle with [[blue bow]]. 
Her theme name is "Caster: Extra Life With Whoever She Wants".

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]], [[Wada Arco]]

body:

title: kirisame_marisa_(witch_of_scarlet_dreams)
body:
[b]Marisa Kirisame, Witch of Scarlet Dreams[/b]

An [[alternate universe]] variation of [[Kirisame Marisa]] in [[Touhou LostWord]], hailing from [b]Z1 Universe[/b].
Until the Lost Word Incident of Scarlet Devil Tower in her world is resolved, Marisa is not present and an alternate personality is in control.

Her design is based on her red [[alternate color]] originated in [[Touhou Hisoutensoku]], which is explained as she have "redshifted" in LostWord.

Some traits are important to keep in mind when determining if the character is the Witch of Scarlet Dreams, or just Marisa in red. First, her black hat and dress have turned red, her white hat ribbon has turned black, and her clothes are more damaged than normal. If these facts are missing, she's likely just Marisa wearing red. Next, her broom is thicker and looks like more than one broomstick twisted together like thin trees. If her broom is present and it's not in this thicker form, assume she's not the Witch of Scarlet Dreams unless otherwise indicated by the artist. Ignore this detail if the broom is not present.

h4. See also

* [[Kirisame Marisa (Witch of Scarlet Dreams on Vacation)]]

title: weezer_(blue_album)
body:
The debut album by the eponymous American band [[Weezer (band)|]], released on May 10, 1994.

The [[album cover]] features four members of the aforementioned band standing in front of the [[simple background|plain]] [[blue background]] with band's name in the upper right corner.

title: stand_(jojo)
body:
Refers to the "Stand" powers in [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]], which typically are portrayed as ghost-like projections of a person's psyche or fighting spirit. The special powers vary widely, such as the ability to [[the fool (stand)|control sand]] or summon a [[silver chariot|sword-wielding warrior]]. They first appear in Part 3 of the manga, with the powers becoming increasingly more complex and abstract as the series goes on.

In Part 3 the first group of Stands are named after the Major Arcana of [[tarot|Tarot cards]] (such as [[Star Platinum]] and [[Hierophant Green]]). As the story continues the new enemy Stands are named after Egyptian gods (such as [[Anubis (stand)|]] and [[Horus (stand)|]]). Near the end some Stands are named after western music groups (such as [[Cream (stand)|]]).

From Part 4 onwards, the vast majority of the Stands' names are named after various western music groups, albums, and songs (such as [[Killer Queen]], [[Aerosmith (stand)|]], [[Foo Fighters (jojo)|]], and [[20th Century Boy (Stand)|]]).

Although usually featured with their "Stand User", it is not uncommon for Stands to be featured by themselves or with other people in fanart. An increasingly common example is [[Dio Brando]]'s Stand [[The World]], which is often featured with [[Touhou]]'s [[Izayoi Sakuya]].

title: red_stone_of_aja
body:
Distinctive red gem from Part 2 of [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Sought after by the Pillar Men, as it is key in their quest for perfection. Often seen as a [[necklace]] on [[Lisa Lisa]].

Given Hirohiko Araki's fondness for musical references, it is not unlikely that the object might be named for either the album [i]Aja[/i], Steely Dan's sixth, released on 23 September 1977, and the song "Aja" on said album.

title: stone_mask_(jojo)
body:
Distinctive stone mask from [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 1: [[Phantom Blood]] and Part 2: [[Battle Tendency]]. An ancient Aztec artifact that bestows vampirism on a human when brought in contact with blood.

[spoiler]The mask was invented by [[kars (jojo)|Kars]] of the race of "super-vampires" called "Pillar Men" to transform them into so-called "Ultimate Beings" when used together with the [[Red Stone of Aja]].[/spoiler]

body:
[i]Defender Operator Bubble isn't scared of anything.[/i]

A playable Defender Operator in [[Arknights]].

An inexperienced young warrior girl from Sargon, her father sent her to Rhodes Island under the pretense of 'training,' but actually to treat her Oripathy.

She uses a spiked shield as her weapon of choice.

Her motif is based on [[Rhinoceros]]. 

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Akao Hikaru]] (JP), Mihu zzZ (CN) and Bang Yeon-ji (KR). Her illustrator is [[Cenm0]].

title: kasodani_kyouko
body:
The "Echoing Sutra Chant". Stage 2 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Ten Desires]].

A loud, enthusiastic youkai, she is a [[yamabiko]] who embodies mountain echoes and has the ability to reflect sound waves.

Because mountain echoes are no longer considered strange, she decided to enter [[Hijiri Byakuren]]'s Myouren Temple and adopt Buddhism. Pictured with a broom, cleaning the grounds and reciting sutras daily are among her duties.

h4. Memes

title: brunhilda_(mythology)
body: Brunhilda, also known as Brynhild, or Brunhild is a prominent figure in Germanic heroic legend, particularly in [[Norse mythology]] and Germanic heroic literature. She is often depicted as a [[Valkyrie]], a warrior maiden serving Odin, who possesses both immense strength and captivating beauty. Her story is one of defiance, love, betrayal, and revenge, often intertwined with the tale of Sigurd (or [[Siegfried (Nibelungenlied)|]]).

body:

title: super_robot_wars
body:
(スーパーロボットたいせんシリーズ, Super Robot Taisen Series, "Super Robot Wars Series"), abbreviated as "SupaRobo" or "SRW". 

A long-running, cross-platform strategic RPG video game series by Banpresto. Its premise is that it combines the characters, stories and (most importantly) mecha of various [[super robot]] and [[mecha]] science fiction anime series. 

This tag refers in particular to original characters created by Banpresto for the games (as well as other elements exclusive to them).

title: sd_gundam_g-generation
body:
A series of turn-based strategy games based on the [[Gundam]] series that began in 1998, utilizing the SD style. Along with retelling of Gundam stories and crossover stories, the games often feature new original characters and MSV [[mobile suit]]s, whether for the Gundam multiverse or unique to G Generation's cast.

This tag covers both references to the games, mechanical or narrative, as well as characters and mechas which originate from it that are canon to the various Gundam universes. For G Generation's own unique material, see [[SD Gundam G Generation Original]].

h4. See also

* [[Gundam Gihren no Yabou]]
* [[Super Robot Wars]]
* [[Compati Hero]]

title: super_robot_wars_original_generation
body:
A subseries of [[Super Robot Wars]] that combines the original characters, [[mecha]], and plot elements from the crossover games into new titles featuring only Banpresto originals. Original characters and units from other Banpresto crossover games appear in the series as well.

The first game in the series was released on [[Game Boy Advance]] in 2002 and featured two playable routes, one following [[Ryuusei Date]] as the main protagonist and the other following [[Kyousuke Nanbu]]. OG1 and [[Super Robot Wars Original Generation 2]] were remade into a single game in [[Super Robot Wars Original Generations]], which was released for [[PlayStation 2]] in 2007.

OG1 introduces the original elements from the following entries:
* The 2nd SRW
* Hero Chronicles: Project Olympus
* The 3rd SRW
* The 4th SRW
* Super Hero Operations
* [[Super Robot Wars Alpha 1]]
* Super Robot Wars Compact 2 - Part 1

title: extra_hands
body:
When a character has more than two hands, whether by accident or design.

Typically an [[artistic error]], although some characters do have extra hands as part of their design. Some, such as [[Nico Robin]], can spawns an additional hands at will.

h4. Examples

* !post #6675992

h4. See also

* [[extra arms]]

title: extra_digits
body:
Having more than five fingers or toes. Usually an [[artistic error]] which amateur and professional artists alike are prone to on occasion. Earlier versions of generative AI are especially infamous for getting hands wrong this way. When not an error, extra fingers can often be found on mutant or otherwise monstrous humanoids.

Polydactyly is a real, albeit rare, genetic condition. Human characters with polydactyly include:

* [[Hannibal Lecter]] - [[The Silence of the Lambs]] (novel)
* Count Tyrone Rugen - [[The Princess Bride]]
* [[Iwamoto Kogan]] - [[Shigurui]]
* [[Ford Pines]] - [[Gravity Falls]]

h4. Examples

* !post #1142825

h4. See also

* [[extra arms]]
* [[fewer digits]] - Less than 5 digits
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: artistic_error
body:
An error or mistake made by the artist, usually in the anatomy, but possibly in other elements such as the coloring, composition, perspective, or the character's appearance.

Common errors include:

* [[extra digits|too many fingers]]
* [[extra hands|too many hands]]
* [[extra legs|too many legs]]
* [[wrong foot|wrong feet]]
* [[wrong hand]]s
* [[bad reflection]]s
* [[bad multiple views]]

This also includes mistakenly drawing a character with the wrong appearance, such as drawing the wrong eye color.

Do not confuse [[artistic error]] with [[bad anatomy]], [[bad proportions]], [[bad hands]], or [[bad feet]], which are for elements that are merely poorly drawn, not outright mistakes. The tag [[QUALITY]] can be applied instead if the artist intentionally recreates the disfigured art for comedic effect.

Generally you should comment on the post describing what the error is.

h4. Examples

* !post #1142825: [[extra digits|Too many fingers]]
* !post #6675992: [[extra hands|Too many hands]]
* !post #71541: [[extra legs|Too many legs]]
* !post #1224840: [[wrong foot|Wrong feet]]
* !post #190107: [[Wrong hand]]s 
* !post #4542873: [[Bad reflection]]s 

h4. See also

h6. Anatomy

* [[extra digits]]
* [[wrong hand]]
* [[wrong foot]]

h6. Language

h6. Intentional

title: office_siren
body:
A fashion trend that was popularized on [[TikTok]] in late 2023, inspired by 90s and 2000s corporate wear and luxury brands, as well as the literary trope of the femme fatale. It has a mysterious, professional and sexy appearance. The character [[Bayonetta]] is a particularly notable source of inspiration on the style, with some even referring to it as "Bayonettacore".

The fashion consists of a mostly monochrome black-white-gray palette (though beige and red are also common), with a form fitting silhouette. Fetish elements such as [[leather]] and [[latex]] clothing, [[harness]]es, and [[corset]]s are often incorporated. Common garments of choice include [[buttons|button-up]] shirts, [[turtleneck sweater]]s, [[pencil skirt]]s, sheer [[thighhighs]], [[peacoat]]s, [[blazer]]s, [[dress pants]], and [[necktie]]s. [[High heels]] and [[glasses]] are also staples of the style.

Not all [[office lady|office ladies]] wear this fashion style, nor do all depictions of the style fall under office lady.

h4. Examples

* !post #8264873
* !post #8146404

h4. See also

* [[Onee Gyaru]]
* [[Tag Group:Fashion style]]

h4. External links

* "Aesthetics Wiki: Office Siren":https://aesthetics.fandom.com/wiki/Office_Siren
* "WWD: What is the Office Siren trend?":https://wwd.com/pop-culture/celebrity-news/feature/office-siren-trend-1236707392/

title: goofy
body:
Anthropomorphic 'dog' character of [[Disney]] cartoons and media, and the third most prominent character in the [[Mickey Mouse & Friends]] franchise. Full name given as "Goofy Goof" in [[Goof Troop]]. Often portrayed as kind and jovial, if dopey and slow mannered. A primary character of the [[Kingdom Hearts]] JRPG series.

h4. Related characters

* [[Max Goof]] (son)

title: pete_(disney)
body: Pete (also named Peg Leg Pete, Bad Pete and Black Pete, among other names) is a cartoon character created by [[Walt Disney]] and Ub Iwerks of The Walt [[Disney]] Company, and part of the [[Mickey Mouse & Friends]] franchise. Pete is traditionally depicted as the villainous arch-nemesis of [[Mickey Mouse]], and was made notorious for his repeated attempts to kidnap [[Minnie Mouse]]. Pete is the oldest continuing Disney character, having debuted in the cartoon Alice Solves the Puzzle in 1925, predating even [[Oswald the Lucky Rabbit]]. He originally bore the appearance of an anthropomorphic [[bear]], but with the advent of Mickey in 1928, he was defined as a [[cat]].

title: daisy_duck
body: A [[Disney]] character, part of the [[Mickey Mouse & Friends]] franchise. She is an anthropomorphic white [[duck]] that has large eyelashes and ruffled tail feathers around her lowest region to suggest a skirt. She is often seen wearing a hair bow, blouse and heeled shoes. The girlfriend of [[Donald Duck]], Daisy was introduced in the short film Mr. Duck Steps Out (1940) and was incorporated into Donald's comic stories several months later. Carl Barks, the screenwriter and lead storyboard artist for the film, was inspired by the 1937 short, Don Donald, that featured a Latin character named Donna Duck, to revive the concept of a female counterpart for Donald.

title: donald_duck
body: Anthropomorphic duck character of [[Disney]] cartoons and media, and the second most prominent character in the [[Mickey Mouse & Friends]] franchise. Portrayal ranges from underhanded rival to easily angered friend to badass. Running jokes may include speech impediments and lack of pants despite presence of shirt. A primary character of the [[Kingdom Hearts]] JRPG series.

title: mickey_mouse
body:
The most recognizable [[Disney]] character, being the de-facto mascot of the company, and leading the [[Mickey Mouse & Friends]] franchise.

He is an anthropomorphic [[mouse (animal)|]] created by [[Walt Disney]] and Co. His character design consist of round black ears, [[white gloves]] [[red pants]] with two yellow buttons, and large [[yellow footwear|yellow shoes]].

His round head and ears have become a trademark symbol; done in a [[silhouette]], and often hidden in pictures as a running gag. His [[dark persona]] version often produces a vicious, characteristic laughter "(“ハハッ”).":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/2690686 

Within the Japanese community, he is often depicted with [[censored identity]] as a spoof to the late 2000s court cases involving Disney Japan suing the fan artists for copyright infringement, which spawned a local meme involving applying the censor across his eye and calling him an "unrelated" character.

Mickey appears with other Disney characters in the video game series [i][[Kingdom Hearts]][/i].

h4. See also

* [[Bugs Bunny]]
* [[Minnie Mouse]]
* [[Mickey Mouse ears]]
* [[Steamboat Willie]]
* [[takobue]]

title: minamoto_no_raikou_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[Tenma Otogizoushi Onigashima]] event. Wields a [[katana]] and [[bow (weapon)|bow]]. Resembles [[Suzuhara Misae]] from [[Mahou Shoujo (Raita)|Zettai Junpaku Mahou Shoujo]]. Allied with [[sakata kintoki (fate)|Sakata Kintoki]] and rivals with [[Shuten Douji (fate)|Shuten-Douji]].

Has [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]] with [[parted bangs]] and [[low-tied long hair|tied at the end]], and [[purple eyes]]. Wears a [[purple bodysuit]] with [[ribbed sleeves]] and [[tabard]] and/or [[loincloth]], with red [[rope]] at various areas. Also wears [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]] with [[kote]], and black [[sandals]] with [[suneate]]. Overall she appears as a tall, [[curvy]] woman, with either [[large breasts|large]] or [[huge breasts]]. Has a [[motherly]] personality.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Honjou Raita]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Tomatsu Haruka]]

title: sei_shounagon_(fate)
body:
An Archer-class servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Imijikarishi Valentine]] event.

An author, poet and court lady to Empress Fujiwara no Teishi. Shounagon authored "The Pillow Book":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Pillow_Book, a book of observations and personal musings she had during her service to the Empress.

Initially introduced herself as Kirakira no Archer, "The Sparkling Archer". She later refers to herself with her informal name Nagiko. She is a contemporary and rival of [[Murasaki Shikibu (fate)|]].

A notable [[otaku]] who tried to be as youthful and "in-touch" with modern culture as possible. Which were shown by her Noble Phantasm [[Emotional Engine - Full Drive]], which features a [[double v]], as well as her (in)famous [[dab (dance)|dabbing]] attack pose.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Mika Pikazo]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Fairouz Ai]]

title: yang_guifei_(fate)
body:

title: oda_nobunaga_(maou_avenger)_(fate)
body:
An older aspect of the Avenger-class [[Oda Nobunaga (fate)|]] that appears in [i][[Fate/Grand Order]][/i], presented as the Nobunaga that became powerful enough to live as the "Devil King of the Sixth Heaven". She is the third ascension of the collective, succeeding Nobunaga as well as  [[oda kippoushi (fate)|a male incarnation in his "Kippoushi" years]].

Unlike most incarnations of Nobunaga, she has [[red hair]]. While she retains the [[red cape]], [[Oda uri]], and [[armored boots]] of her younger self, this Nobunaga instead wears a black [[bodysuit]]. Her [[red eyes]] are still present.

title: oda_nobunaga_(fate)
body:
Heroic spirit appearing in the [[Fate (series)|]], being a [[genderswap (mtf)|]]ped version of [[Oda Nobunaga]]. She comes from a parallel timeline, with the version from proper human history being a male. She first appeared as the Demon Archer of [[Saber (fate)|Artoria]] in [[Koha-Ace]] as the second new servant after the [[Okita Souji (koha-ace)|Sakura Saber]]. She was introduced into [[Fate/Grand Order]] with the [[GUDAGUDA Honnouji]] event, and appears as the servant of [[Asama Kaname]] in [[Fate/type Redline]].

Nobunaga is often depicted in [[naked cape]] as a result of a running gag in Koha-Ace about how she would occasionally "feeling hot", referencing the real life counterpart's death during the Honnouji temple incident. This were later elaborated upon in a more symbolic meaning in [[Fate/Grand Order]] (where this specific "outfit" is available as her final ascension art) as being her "accepting" her death and giving up on her honor and power that she can't take to the afterlife.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Keikenchi]]
[b]Illustrator:[/b] [[pako (pakosun)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kugimiya Rie]]

title: nursery_rhyme_(fate)
body:
Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/EXTRA]], [[Fate/EXTRA CCC]], and [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She is the manifestation of Nursery Rhymes, and she is a representation of the imaginations and dreams of children across the ages.

First appears as an Enemy Servant in [[Fate/EXTRA]]. [[Alice (fate)|]] is her Master in that game, and Nursery Rhyme borrows her appearance. To tell the two apart, Nursery Rhyme wears black and purple clothes, and her doll joints are black.

title: siamese_cat
body:
A breed of [[cat]] originated from [[Thailand]] (formerly Siam). Notable characteristic include overall grey fur, with black on the ears and face.

Not all [[colorpoint]] cats are Siamese. Siamese cats have short fur and blue eyes. Modern Siamese cats have an "Oriental" face and body structure with long ears, a long face, and a skinny body. This tag also includes the "Thai cat":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thai_cat breed (also known as "Applehead" Siamese), which has a more typical body type.

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia page":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siamese_cat]

title: michelle_(project_moon)
body: The real-world version of [spoilers][[Hod (Project Moon)|]][/spoilers] who worked for Lobotomy Corporation before the events of [[lobotomy corporation|the game]]. The youngest employee, she had short [[brown hair]], [[blue eyes]], an [[ahoge]], and wore a [[lab coat]] with [[sleeves past fingers]].

title: angela_(project_moon)
body:
Main character of two of [[Project Moon]]'s games.

In [[Lobotomy Corporation]], she is the AI helper of the Manager, whom the player controls. She has [[very long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with [[one side up]], a notably [[large breasts|large-breasted appearance]] covered by a [[white coat|lab coat]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]], a [[black vest]] (sometimes drawn as a jacket, seeing as there's no real way to tell whether it has sleeves or not), [[pantyhose]] and [[red footwear|red]] [[high heels]].
She often has her [[closed eyes|eyes closed]].

In [[Library of Ruina]], she undergoes a massive appearance change due to spoilery reasons.
Her hair turns [[short hair|short]], and her [[yellow eyes]] are now always open.
She swaps her previous office clothes for a new set of Librarian clothes.
She wears a [[blue coat]] with [[frilled sleeves|frills]], a [[white ascot]] with a [[brooch]] and [[black feathers|feather-like decorations]], a [[black skirt]] with a [[black vest]] and a [[white shirt]].
She's usually seen holding a [[book]] or surrounded by [[pages]] or [[bookshelf|bookshelves]].

[Spoiler]At the start of the game and during one of its bad endings, she wears a [[black dress]] that seems to be made up of feathers.[/spoilers]

During the events of the game, she resonates with various abnormalities gaining their [[E.G.O (project moon)|]], which looks and acts different from that of Lobotomy Corporation's.

title: carmen_(project_moon)
body:
Character from [[Lobotomy Corporation]], makes appearances in [[Project Moon]]'s later works due to her story relevancy.

Wears a [[lab coat]], a [[green shirt]], and ties her [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in a [[high ponytail]] using a [[bear hair ornament|bear-shaped accesory]]. She has [[red eyes]].

title: daniel_(project_moon)
body:
[[Lobotomy Corporation]] character. An elite member of society who was so charming, talented and wealthy that he could have easily gotten into any of the Wings had he wanted, but was convinced by Carmen to join the Lobotomy Corporation instead. [spoiler]He was [[Chesed (project moon)|]]’s past ego.[/spoiler]

He has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. His outfit is a [[brown suit]] worn with [[black vest]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[striped necktie]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

h4. See also

title: kali_(project_moon)
body: The former identity of [[Gebura (project_moon)|]]. A Color Fixer known as "The Red Mist".

title: angelica_(project_moon)
body:
[[Library of Ruina]] character, married to [[Roland (project moon)|]].
Based off of "Angelica":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angelica_(character) from the 15th and 16th century epic poems "Orland Innamorato":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orlando_Innamorato and "Orlando Furioso":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orlando_Furioso.

She wears a [[black jacket]] with [[black sweater|black]] [[turtleneck sweater]], a [[ring necklace]], [[black pants]], and a pair of [[black gloves]] [Spoiler] which she uses to store her arsenal of weapons and create an area of silence around her, giving her the title of the Black Silence[/spoiler]

[Spoiler][[Angelica (project moon)|]] and her brother [[Argalia (project moon)|]] are both Colour fixers, the Black Silence and Blue Reverberation respectively.
She and her unborn child perished before the game's events to [[The Pianist (project moon)|]], kick-starting the game's entire plot. Her death caused [[Roland (project moon)|]] to inherit her title of the Black Silence and rampage through the city in a vain attempt to get revenge on the one responsible for her death while her brother [[Argalia (project moon)|]] was driven insane by her death and distorted.[/spoiler]

title: argalia_(project_moon)
body:
Antagonist from [[Library of Ruina]].

[[Roland (project moon)|]]'s brother-in-law and [[Angelica (project moon)|]]'s brother.
He has long flowing [[white hair]], [[blue eyes]], and wears a [[blue cape]] and [[blue jacket|jacket]] with [[black pants]] and [[white gloves]], most of these clothes [[gold trim]]med.

Carries a [[scythe]] as his weapon.

[spoiler]In his [[Distortion (project moon)|Distorted]] form, his head resembles a cloud with one big eye.
He's often drawn resembling a small one-eyed cloud or animal in this form (post #6975221).[/spoiler]

title: roland_(project_moon)
body:
One of [[Library of Ruina]]'s main characters.

Based off of the 11th century poem "Song of Roland":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Song_of_Roland], with further inspiration from the 15th and 16th century epic poems "Orland Innamorato":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orlando_Innamorato and "Orlando Furioso":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orlando_Furioso. He differs from his inspirations by being married to [[Angelica (project moon)|]].

He wears intentionally basic clothes, consisting of a [[suit]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] and [[black necktie]]. Before his arrival to the Library, he wore a [[black mask]] that blocked people's perception of who he was.

body:
[[Limbus Company]] character.

[[Hong Lu (Project Moon)|]]'s younger sister. Based on the "character of the same name":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dream_of_the_Red_Chamber#Jia_Baoyu_and_the_Twelve_Beauties_of_Jinling from "Dream of the Red Chamber":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dream_of_the_Red_Chamber.

title: gregor_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus company]] character. 

Sinner No.13 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named and based off of the main protagonist of the 20th century novella "The Metamorphosis":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Metamorphosis written by German author "Franz Kafka":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franz_Kafka.

He has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] kept in a [[low ponytail]], a massive [[arthropod limbs|insectile claw]] in place of his right arm (which he retains, [[prosthetic arm|replaces]] or has [[amputee|amputated]] across all of his identities and [[e.g.o (project moon)|E.G.O]]), a [[tattoo]] on his [[arm tattoo|left arm]], wears [[semi-rimless eyewear]], [[smoking|smokes]] [[cigarette|cigarettes]], and is almost always accompanied by a [[cockroach]]. He wears the uniform of all [[Limbus Company]] sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black vest]], [[black pants]], but has [[short sleeves]] and excludes the [[black coat]]. 

His right arm is a massive [[arthropod limbs|insectile claw]] that he uses as his primary weapon in his base identity, while his left arm is tattooed with the German word 'UNGEZIEFER' ('Vermin' In English). 

h4. Official art

* !post #5026004

title: demian_(project_moon)
body: Named and based off of the titular character of the 20th century bildungsroman '"Demian":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demian' written by "Hermann Hesse":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hermann_Hesse, [spoilers] with various motifs derived from "The Little Prince":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Little_Prince.

title: sinclair_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus Company]] character.

Sinner No.11 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named and based on the narrator of the 20th century bildungsroman "Demian":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demian written by "Hermann Hesse":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hermann_Hesse.

He has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. He wears the uniform of all [[Limbus Company]] sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black pants]], [[black coat]], but replaces the [[black vest]] with [[suspenders]] and additionally wears a pair of [[black gloves]].

He wields a large [[halberd]] with the German word 'Vogel' ('Bird' in English) written on the blade in his base identity.

h4. Official art

* !post #5026028: [[Official art]]

title: rodion_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus Company]] character.

Sinner No.09 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named after and based off of the protagonist of the 19th century novel "Crime and Punishment":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crime_and_Punishment written by "Fyodor Dostoevsky":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fyodor_Dostoevsky.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]], [[parted bangs]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[heart tattoo]] on her [[chest tattoo|chest]]. She wears the uniform of all Limbus Company sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[black vest]], [[belt]], [[black pants]], [[black coat]], but excludes the [[red necktie]].

She wields an [[axe]] in her base identity, with the Russian word 'РАСКО́Л' ('SPLIT' In English) written on the head of the blade.

h4. Official art

* !post #5026015

title: ishmael_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus Company]] character.

Sinner No.08 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named after the narrator of the 19th century novel "Moby-Dick.":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moby-Dick

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[orange hair]], [[green eyes]], [[freckles]], and wears a [[headband]] made of rope with 2 [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow]]s. She wears the uniform of all Limbus Company sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black vest]], [[belt]], [[black pants]], but has a [[torn coat|torn]] [[black coat]] the length of a [[jacket]] instead of the standard [[black coat]]. 

She wields both a [[shield]] and [[flanged mace]] in her base identity with the English word 'Hearse' written on the shield. Her rope headband is consistent across all of her identities, although sometimes wearing it as a [[hairband]] or attaching it to her weapon instead of wearing it.

Sometimes drawn with [[tentacle hair]] due to a certain prerelease artwork (post #7489139).

title: catherine_(project_moon)
body:
Character from [[Limbus Company]], based on Wuthering Heights' Catherine Earnshaw.
She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], and wears a [[brown dress]] and [[brown jacket]] with [[brown gloves]].

[spoilers][[Every Catherine (project moon)|]] is one of her mirror selves who communicated with her to convince her to kickstart Canto VI's events.[/spoilers]

title: heathcliff_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus Company]] character.

Sinner No.07 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named and based on the main character of the 19th century novel "Wuthering Heights":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wuthering_Heights written by English novelist "Emily Brontë":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emily_Brontë.

He has [[short hair|short]], [[messy hair|messy]], [[brown hair|brown hair]], [[dark skin]], [[purple eyes]], [[scar|scars]] across his entire body, and wears a [[ring]] across most of his identities. He wears the uniform of all [[Limbus Company]] sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black pants]], but replaces the [[black vest]] and [[black coat]] with a [[shoulder holster]]. 

He wields a metallic [[baseball bat]] with the English word 'REVENGE' etched into the side in his base identity. [spoiler]After Canto VI, the word etched into the bat is changed to 'REmember'.[/spoiler] 

h4. Official art
* !post #5026237

h4. See also
* [spoiler][[Erlking Heathcliff (project moon)|]][/spoiler]
* [[List of Project Moon characters]]

title: hong_lu_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus Company]] character.

Sinner No.06 of [[Limbus Company]]. Based off of the main character Jia Baoyu from the 19th century Chinese novel "Dream of the Red Chamber":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dream_of_the_Red_Chamber written by 18th century novelist "Cao Xueqin":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cao_Xueqin.

Average height and build with pale skin and a feminine appearance. He has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair|purple-ish black hair]] kept in a [[high ponytail]] or [[half updo]] in most identities. He has [[heterochromia]], with a [[black eyes|black right eye]] and [[blue eyes|cyan left eye]]. He wears the uniform of all [[Limbus Company]] Sinners, a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black vest]], [[black coat]], and [[black pants]].

He primarily wields a [[guan dao]] wrapped in red ribbons in his base identity, with the words '太虛幻境' written upon the edge of the blade.

h4. Official art

* !post #5026341

title: meursault_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus company]] character. 

Sinner No.05 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named and based off of the main protagonist of the 20th century novella "The Stranger":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Stranger_(Camus_novel) written by French author "Albert Camus":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_Camus.

He has [[short hair|short]], [[hair slicked back|slicked]] [[black hair]], [[green eyes]], a constant [[expressionless|perpetual frown]], and wears a unique [[belt]] across all of his identities. He wears the uniform of all [[Limbus Company]] sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black vest]], [[black pants]], but excludes the [[black coat]] and wears a unique [[belt]]. 

He wears two metal [[gauntlets]] in his base identity, with the French word 'SOLEIL' ('SUN' in English) upon his right [[single gauntlet|gauntlet]].

h4. Official art

* !post #5028500

title: don_quixote_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus Company]] character. 

Sinner No.03 of [[Limbus Company]]. Based on and named after [[alonso quixano|the main protagonist]] of the 17th century Spanish novel [[Don Quixote (novel)|]] written by "Miguel de Cervantes":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miguel_de_Cervantes. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] kept in a [[bob cut]], [[yellow eyes]] that frequently [[+_+|sparkle]], and always wears a pair of worn [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]] with the name "Rocinante":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rocinante across all of her identities. She wears the uniform of all [[Limbus Company]] sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black pants]], [[black coat]], but excludes the [[black vest]] and additionally adorns her uniform with various pins of famous fixers (Most notably [[iori (project moon)|The Purple Tear]]). 

She wields a towering [[polearm|joust]] in her base identity with the Spanish words 'SUEÑO IMPOSIBLE' ('IMPOSSIBLE DREAM' in English) written on it, the name of main theme song of [[Man of La Mancha]], the first official musical adaptation of Don Quixote.

[spoiler]She is revealed to be a second-generation Bloodfiend in Intervallo IV-2 after losing her shoes in a confrontation with [[Cassetti (project moon)|]]. Canto VII further reveals that she was formerly named [[Sancho (project moon)|]], having purposely wiped her memories by drinking from the River of Oblivion, suppressed her nature as a Bloodfiend with Rocinante, and adopted the name of the [[La Manchaland's Don Quixote (project moon)|First Kindred]] that sired her.[/spoiler]

h4. Official art

* !post #5026306

h4. See also
* [spoiler][[Sancho (project moon)|]][/spoiler]
* [spoiler][[La Manchaland's Don Quixote (project moon)|]][/spoiler]
* [[List of Project Moon characters]]

title: sancho_(project_moon)
body:
[spoiler] The previous identity of [[Don Quixote (project moon)|]] and her Bloodfiend form. Based on and named after [[sancho panza|the deuteragonist]] of the 17th century Spanish novel [[Don Quixote (novel)|]] written by "Miguel de Cervantes":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miguel_de_Cervantes.

In the past, she wore a [[brown coat]] with [[epaulettes]], a [[white jacket]] with an [[aiguillette]], [[white pants]], [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]] and wore a [[red fur|red]] [[feather boa]]. 
In the present, she wears [[Don Quixote (project moon)|]]'s Limbus Company uniform but goes [[barefoot]] without her [[boots]] Rocinante, covers her coat in [[hemokinesis|hard blood]] and wears the same [[red fur|red]] [[feather boa]]. 
Across both, she has [[wavy hair]] and [[red eyes]].

title: faust_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus Company]] character.

Sinner No.02 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named after and based off of the titular character "Faust":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Faust from German folklore, along with her creation [[Mephistopheles (project moon)|]].

She has [[medium hair|medium length]] [[white hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears the uniform of all Limbus Company sinners, consisting of a [[red necktie]], [[black vest]], [[belt]], [[black pants]] but wears a [[turtleneck sweater]] instead of the standard [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] and a [[torn coat|torn]] [[black coat]] she wears on her [[coat on shoulders|shoulders]]. 

She wields a [[zweihander]] in her base identity with the German word 'WALPURGISNACHT' written on its blade. 

h4. Official art

* !post #5028568

title: yi_sang_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus company]] character. 

Sinner No.01 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named and based on both the 20th century Korean poet "Kim Hae-Gyeong":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yi_Sang and the protagonist of their novel "The Wings":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wings_(novel). 

He has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], [[black eyes]] with noticeable [[bags under eyes|bags]], an almost permanently [[exhausted]] expression, and carries a [[satchel]] containing a [[book]] and [[dagger]] across all of his identities. He wears the uniform of all [[Limbus Company]] sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black vest]], [[black pants]], and a [[black coat]] he wears [[coat on shoulders|over his shoulders]]. 

He primarily wields a [[dagger|saingeom]] in his base identity, and carries a [[book]] and [[satchel]] bag labeled with the Korean name '하융' ('Ha Yong', a pseudonym used by Kim Hae-Gyeong) across all of his identities.

His base E.G.O is [[Crow's Eye View (e.g.o)|]].

h4. Official art

* !post #5026033

title: piss_tea_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originated a scene from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] part 5 [[Vento Aureo]].

The scene involves a [[tea party]] hosted by the Passione members to welcome [[Giorno Giovanna]]. After a brief conversation, [[Leone Abbacchio]] who is despising Giorno's idealism at that time, secretly [[peeing]] inside a [[teapot]] under the table and hands it over to Giorno to "prove [his] trustworthiness". Giorno then dramatically [[drinking pee|drank the whole cup of "tea" without hesitation]], much to Abbacchio's shock. [spoiler]In reality, Giorno uses the power of [[Gold Experience]] to turn one of his tooth into a jellyfish to absorb the "tea" without actually tasting it.[/spoiler]

This particular scene later spawned the slang "Aba-[[tea]]" (アバ茶 [i]"aba-cha"[/i]), which later became a byword for [[drinking pee|pee drinking]]/serving fetish.

title: torture_dance
body:
A [[dancing|dance]] performed by [[Guido Mista]], [[Narancia Ghirga]], and [[Pannacotta Fugo]] in the [[vento_aureo|fifth part]] of [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken|]]. 

While the manga only featured the dance in four panels, it proved popular with the fans that it was expanded in the video games. Furthermore, in the anime adaptation, a song titled [i]Canzoni Preferite[/i] (Favorite Songs), arranged by Kanno Yuugo and sung by Hasegawa Daisuke, was used when this scene was vastly expanded upon. The adaptation turned what is a four-panel gag into a roughly minute-long music video, complete with psychedelic imagery and effects.

title: abbacchio_joins_the_kicking_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] based on a scene in [[Vento Aureo]]. It features [[Leone Abbacchio]] taking a sip of wine, watching [[Guido Mista]] and [[Narancia Ghirga]] beat up and stomp on a passerby... before promptly joining them in the beating.

h4. External Links

* "Know Your Meme: Abbacchio Joins the Kicking":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/abbacchio-joins-the-kicking]

title: soul_(deltarune)
body:
Major character in [[Deltarune]] [spoiler]and arguably the true player character, as it is shown throughout the story to be controlling [[Kris (Deltarune)|]] against their wishes; this is most notable in the [[Weird Route (deltarune)|]], in which they openly express outrage and disgust at its actions.[/spoiler]
It takes the form of a floating red [[heart]], identical to its appearance in sister game [[Undertale]].

title: gym
body:
A gym, or gymnasium is an athletic facility equipped for physical training, weight lifting, and sport.

For the room that stores a gym's equipment, see [[gym storeroom]].

title: eram_(deltarune)
body: Also referred to as simply the Shadow Mantle Holder. Character from Chapter 3 of [[Deltarune]]. [spoiler]They're a secret boss that can be fought when the player completes all S-Rank minigames, and yields a Shadow Mantle upon defeat[/spoiler]. They're depicted as a black cloaked figure with horns and an orange mouth.

title: parachute_pants
body:
Surprisingly tight-fitting and also known as flight pants, "[[parachute]]" referred to the pants' nylon material, similar to a parachute's. Parachute pants became a fad in US culture in the 1980s as part of the increased popularity of [[breakdance]].

You may be looking for [[harem pants]] depending on if you're looking for [[baggy pants]] with more fabric closer to the [[feet]].

title: soft_machine
body: The [[stand (jojo)|stand]] of [[Mario Zucchero]].

title: spice_girl_(stand)
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Trish Una]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as a feminine pink humanoid decorated with mathematical symbols and is, unlike most Stands, fully sentient.

Possesses the power to "soften" things, increasing their malleability and giving them a rubber-like consistency. Spice Girl can abruptly return the object to its original state, or use its considerable strength to break the object cleanly.

Namesake is the British pop girl group Spice Girls. Screams "WANNABEEEEEE" during its finishing attack, which is the name of one of their songs.

title: gold_experience_requiem
body:
Evolved requiem form of the [[stand (jojo)|]] [[Gold Experience]] from the end of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 5, [[Vento Aureo]].

[spoiler]In addition to increased life creation power, GER has gained "nullification" ability, which can be used to "nullify" any attempt made by an enemy to harm it and [[Giorno Giovanna|its user]] through manipulation of space, time, and fate itself, and reversing anything around them to the original state. 

When anyone is "killed" by GER, they will stuck in an infinite loop of them suffering all kinds of fatal injuries over and over, only for them to be moved to the new scenario when they are about to "die" in the previous world and suffering the same fate again, rinse and repeat.[/spoiler]
other_names: ゴールド・エクスペリエンス・レクイエム

title: nijimura_okuyasu
body:
A supporting character from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 4. His [[Stand (jojo)|]] is [[The Hand (stand)|]]. His [[gakuran]] is heavily ornamented with currency symbols ([[dollar sign]] and [[yen sign]]), a design motif his Stand shares.

His elder brother is [[Nijimura Keicho]].

title: hazekura_mikitaka
body:
A supporting character from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 4. Claims to be an alien from outer space. Possesses an ability named [[Earth Wind & Fire (stand)|]], allowing Mikitaka to transform into objects. It's unclear if this is truly a [[Stand (jojo)|]] power or a trait of his potentially alien physiology.

Gives his full name as "Nu Mikitakazo Nshi", presumably his "alien" name.
other_names: ヌ・ミキタカゾ・ンシ

During the course of the story, he befriends [[Higashikata Josuke]] and [[Nijimura Okuyasu]].

His nickname is known as "Shigechii".

title: shizuka_joestar
body: A baby girl who developed the [[stand_(jojo)|Stand]] "[[Achtung Baby]]" (but wasn't able to control it) that rendered her invisible. She was discovered by [[Joseph Joestar (old)|]] (after her parents apparently lost her, possibly due to her invisibility) and adopted her as [b]Shizuka Joestar[/b] into the Joestar family.

title: kishibe_rohan
body:
A supporting character from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 4. His [[Stand (jojo)|]] is [[Heaven's Door]]. Wears a distinctive jagged headband and earrings that look like fountain pen nibs.

A famous Mangaka, Rohan may be a fantastical [[artist self-insert]] of [[Araki Hirohiko]]. He shares Araki's love of traveling and has starred in multiple one-shot side stories titled [[Kishibe Rohan Wa Ugokanai]].

He became the origin of Japanese meme, "だが断る" ("[i][[Daga Kotowaru]][/i]", "[b]I REFUSE.[/b] What I like to do the most is say NO to people who consider themselves extremely good."). It is used to refuse "'an offer he can't refuse.'":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Godfather#Cultural_influence_and_legacy 

h4. External links

* [[2channel]] Ascii-art Illustrations (Japanese): "[i]Daga Kotowaru[/i]":http://riceballman.fc2web.com/AA-Illust/Data/Rohan.html

title: the_world
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Dio Brando]] [spoiler]and an alternate version of [[Diego Brando]][/spoiler] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Possesses the ability to [[time stop|stop time]], along with having incredible speed and strength. It mainly attacks with a barrage of punches while shouting "MUDA MUDA MUDA!"

Manifests as a [[muscular]] golden man wearing a characteristic [[helmet]]. Example: post #508357.

Name is based on [i][[The World (tarot)|]][/i] [[Tarot]] card of the Major Arcana.

For the meme spawned by this, see [[ZA WARUDO]].

title: kujo_holy
body:
Character from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 3.
 
Born Holly Joestar, she is the daughter of [[Joseph Joestar (old)|]] and [[Suzi Q]] and is [[Kujo Jotaro]]'s mother. Married to a Japanese jazz musician named [[Kujo Sadao]] that is never shown.

title: kujo_sadao
body:
A minor character in [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] mentioned in Part 3.

He is the husband of [[Kujo Holy]] and father of [[Kujo Jotaro]]. As a famous jazz musician, he is always on tour and is never seen in the series.

title: j._geil
body:
A villain from the third part of [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Uses a [[Stand (jojo)|]] named [[Hanged Man (stand)|]], named after the 12th trump of the Tarot.

Renamed Centerfold in some official English translations for copyright reasons.

Has two right hands (so don't tag this as [[artistic error]]).

title: pet_shop
body:
Pet [[falcon]] of [[Dio Brando]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 3. Its [[stand (jojo)|]] is [[Horus (stand)|]].

Extremely intelligent and ruthless for a [[bird]]. Wears a [[helmet]] with [[feathers]] sticking out of the top, and a [[scarf]].

Namesake is the English dance music duo Pet Shop Boys.

title: lisa_lisa
body:
Central character in [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 2: Battle Tendency. A powerful user of the [i]Hamon[/i] martial art, she is the master of [[Caesar Anthonio Zeppeli]] and [[Joseph Joestar (young)|]]. 

[spoiler]She is [[Joseph Joestar]]'s mother, Elisabeth Joestar, gone into hiding after the death of her husband [[George Joestar II]], [[jonathan joestar|Jonathan]]'s son.[/spoiler] 

The head of the band Lisa Lisa and Cult Jam is her namesake.

title: suzi_q
body:
Supporting character from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Parts 2 and 3. Assistant of [[Lisa Lisa]]. Later marries Part 2 protagonist [[Joseph Joestar (old)|]] and has a child named [[Kujo Holy]].

Originally introduced as just "Susie Q", her full name was revealed in the artbook [i]JoJo 6251[/i]. Following the musical naming motif of the series, her name may be a double reference to both the Dale Dawkins song "Susie Q" and the singer-songwriter Susan Kay "Suzi" Quatro.

title: joseph_joestar_(young)
body:
[[Joseph Joestar]] as he appears in [[Battle Tendency]]. As a young teenager, Joseph uses the power of the [[Hamon]] (Ripple) to defeat the Pillar Men.

h4. See also

* [[Your next line is]]
* [[Joseph Joestar (Tequila)]]
other_names: ジョセフ・ジョースター

title: joseph_joestar_(old)
body:
[[Joseph Joestar]] as he appears in [[Stardust Crusaders]] and [[Diamond wa Kudakenai]].

He is one of the protagonists in [[Stardust Crusaders]] and a supporting character in [[Diamond wa Kudakenai]], appearing in both as an [[old man]]. He obtains a [[Stand (jojo)|]] power in Part 3 known as [[Hermit Purple]].

h4. See also

* [[Hermit Purple]]
* [[Joseph Joestar (young)]]
other_names: ジョセフ・ジョースター

title: george_joestar_ii
body:
Character in [i][[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]][/i], introduced during the [i][[Battle Tendency]][/i] arc.

The son of [[Jonathan Joestar]] and [[Erina Pendleton]] and father of [[Joseph Joestar (old)|]]. He was a famous fighter pilot during his service in World War I, and thus is typically depicted with his [[military uniform]] and [[garrison cap]] on.

He appears as one of the protagonists of the non-canon [i][[Jorge Joestar]][/i] novel. In this verse, he is born in Spain and subsequently named in Spanish style.
other_names: ジョージ・ジョースターII世

title: santana_(jojo)
body:
Character from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 2. One of the Pillar Men, vampires vastly superior to those created by the [[Stone Mask (jojo)|]]. 

Namesake is the American band Santana.

title: dario_brando
body: [[Dio Brando]]'s Father.

title: danny_(jojo)
body:
[[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] character.

[[Jonathan Joestar]]'s childhood pet dog. Danny is a Harlequin [[Great Dane]].

title: johnny_joestar
body:
One of the main protagonists of [[Steel Ball Run]], alongside [[Gyro Zeppeli]]. A paraplegic former horse jockey that resolves to follow [[Gyro Zeppeli]] in the Steel Ball Run race, hoping he may hold the key to letting him walk again.

His [[stand (jojo)|Stand]] power is [[Tusk (Stand)|Tusk]]. Wears a hat with a horse head/horseshoe emblem on the front.

Most of the time he wears: [[Hoodie]] with [[short sleeves]] and [[heart ornament]] on them, [[beanie]] with [[horseshoe hat ornament]] and [[star print|print of stars]] on beanie, pants and wristband, horse head print. In winter location he wear hoodie with [[long sleeves]] and [[feathers]] in [[hood]]. In both suits he wears pants with [[star print]]. 
But in anime he wear [[blue pants]] without [[star print]] and fused with boots, [[white beanie]] with print of horse head and [[horseshoe hat ornament]], [[white hoodie]] with purple line on them, blue [[heart ornament]] on short [[two-tone sleeves]] and [[american flag]] stylized [[wristband]]
other_names: ジョニィ・ジョースター

title: elma_(maidragon)
body:
One of the main characters in [[Kobayashi-san chi no Maidragon]]. A cheerful sea [[dragon]] who takes her refuge in the human world under the guise of a serious [[office lady]] under the name [b]Inoue Elma[/b].

In her [[dragon girl]] form, she has a [[short hair|short]] [[black hair|black]] [[gradient hair]] that transitioned into [[purple hair|purple]] at the tip. She has [[parted bangs]] where her large [[single horn]] were located. She wears a [[black leotard]] under her [[short kimono|short]] [[purple kimono|purple]] [[kimono]] and a [[brown scarf]]. She also wields a [[trident]] as her weapon.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4637090
other_names: エルマ(小林さんちのメイドラゴン)

title: vento_aureo
body:
(Ougon no Kaze, "Golden Wind")

Part 5 of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]].

Originally serialized in Weekly Shounen Jump from 1995 to 1999 for 155 chapters and collected in seventeen volumes, it was later adapted as the 39-episode fourth season of the TV anime, which aired from 2018 to 2019.

title: diamond_wa_kudakenai
body:
Part 4 of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]].

Translated in English as "Diamond Is Unbreakable". Alternatively and earlier "[[engrish text|translated]]" as "Diamond Is Not Crash" in the infamous [[Duwang]] scanlations.

Originally serialized in Weekly Shounen Jump from 1992 to 1995 for 174 chapters and collected in eighteen volumes, it was later adapted as the 39-episode third season of the TV anime, which aired in 2016.

title: stardust_crusaders
body:
Part 3 of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]].

Originally serialized in Weekly Shounen Jump from 1989 to 1992 for 152 chapters and collected into sixteen volumes, it was later adapted into an OVA series, between 1993 and 2002, and the 48-episode second season of the TV anime, which aired from 2014 to 2015.

This story arc marked the first appearance of [[stand (jojo)|stands]], which would become a staple in the JoJo universe.

h4. Characters | Stands

h6. Protagonists

* [[Kujo Jotaro]] | [[Star Platinum]]
* [[Joseph Joestar (old)|]] | [[Hermit Purple]]
* [[Mohammed Avdol]] | [[Magician's Red]]
* [[Kakyoin Noriaki]] | [[Hierophant Green]]
* [[Jean Pierre Polnareff]] | [[Silver Chariot]]
* [[Iggy (jojo)|]] | [[The Fool (stand)|]]

title: phantom_blood
body:
Part 1 of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. It is set primarily in 1888 England.

Originally serialized in Weekly Shounen Jump in 1987 for 44 chapters and collected into 5 volumes, it was later adapted into a 2007 film, which is now considered lost due to the movie bombing in the box office as well as a controversy over Part 3, and the first nine episodes of the first season of the 2012 anime.

This story arc marked the first appearance of the [[stone mask (jojo)|stone mask]] and [[hamon]].

title: gekkan_mu
body: A Japanese magazine published since November 1979, dedicated to the occult and paranormal. It is the oldest and only regular magazine of its kind in Japan. Easily recognized by its stylized red 「ムー」 logo.

title: kaniki_(sameko_saba)
body:
Fan mascot of [[Indie Virtual Youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Sameko Saba]].

The name "Kaniki" is a portmanteau of the Japanese words for crab (蟹, [i]kani[/i]) and older brother (兄貴, [i]aniki[/i]).

Stylized as a round [[chibi|chibified]] red crab with an [[x_anus|X]] for a butt.

title: liminal_space
body:
Liminal spaces are an aesthetic portraying empty or abandoned places that appear eerie, forlorn, and often surreal. The word "liminal" in this case refers to places that are typically in-between or transitional, such as hallways, waiting rooms, hotels or shopping malls. However, it does not necessarily have to be indoors to be considered a liminal space.

h4. See also

* [[Backrooms (Creepypasta)]]
* [[Dream Pool]]
* [[The Exit 8]]
* [[Horror (theme)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article: Liminal space (aesthetic)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liminal_space_(aesthetic)]

title: maitake_dance
body:
A dance originating from a YouTube short posted by the [[hololive DEV_IS]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Juufuutei Raden]] on August 6th, 2024. The short shows an animation by [[Bakakun]] of a [[chibi]] Raden dancing while she sings a song about [[maitake (mushroom)|maitake mushrooms]]. It was part of a series of other short videos she made about various types of mushrooms (pool #23983).

Thanks to its energetic, earworm lyrics, the short went viral. It accumulated millions of views in just a few months and inspired various memes, parodies, and videos of people performing the dance.

h4. External links

* "Youtube: Original Video":[https://youtube.com/shorts/hymOcFUkCHU] (post #8132428)
* "Know Your Meme: Maitake Guru Guru":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/maitake-guru-guru]

title: pillbug
body:
A pill bug is the common name for any of the species of woodlice, terrestrial [[crustacean]]s, in the family Armadillidiidae. Their notable feature is their ability to curl up into a ball as a defensive behavior.  Other common names for them are roly polies, slaters, and doodle bugs.

h4. See also

* [[Arachnid]]
* [[Bug]]
* "Wikipedia - Armadillidiidae":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armadillidiidae]

title: yagami_hikari
body:
Yagami Hikari, a character from [[Digimon]]

Digidestined of Light and partner of [[Tailmon]], little sister of [[Yagami Taichi]]. She is the eighth chosen child, not that anyone knows it at first.
She lives with her father, [[Yagami Susumu]], a businessman, her mother, [[Yagami Yuuko (digimon)|]], a housewife, and her older brother, Taichi. In Adventure, they also had a cat, Miiko.

Age: 4 ([[Digimon Adventure (1999 Movie)|]]), 8 ([[Digimon Adventure]]), 11 ([[Digimon  Adventure 02]]), 14 ([[Digimon Adventure Tri.]])
Birthday: 1991

title: ishida_yamato
body:
Ishida "Matt" Yamato is a character in the anime series [[Digimon Adventure]], [[Digimon Adventure 02]] and [[Digimon Adventure tri.]]. 
He is a DigiDestined, partnered with [[Gabumon]], and the bearer of the Crest of Friendship. He is the older brother of [[Takaishi Takeru]].

title: takaishi_takeru
body: Takaishi "T.K." Takeru is a character in the anime series [[Digimon Adventure]], [[Digimon Adventure 02]], and [[Digimon Adventure tri.]] and its assosiated media. He is a DigiDestined, partnered with [[Patamon]], and embodies the trait of Hope. He is the younger brother of [[Ishida Yamato]].

title: duosion
body:
[[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] #0578 in the National Pokédex, a Psychic-type.

A pale green Pokémon encased in a darker green, gel-like substance. Has stubby arms and a [[diamond mouth]], and is usually seen [[floating]].

Evolves from [[Solosis]], and into [[Reuniclus]].
